loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Hola mi nombre es Maria R. me dedico a la venta de productos para uso personal, como ser cremas, lociones, perfumes, tratamientos para la cara, desodorantes etc. tengo 8 años de tener este negocio, soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos los cuales dependen totalmente de mi, soy una persona muy responsable y siempre estoy muy contenta por todo lo que Dios me ha dado, tengo muchos deseos de superarme, en estos momentos necesito el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia porque viene la epoca navideña y en estos dias las ventas son muy buenas. asi podre mejorar mi negocio y mi calidad de vida y mantener mi familia que es lo mas importante que tengo en mi vida.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Maria R.. I sell products for personal use, such as cremes, lotions, perfumes, facial treatments, deodorants, etc. I've been in this business for eight years. I am a single mother with two children who rely totally on me. I am a very responsible person and am always very happy with everything God has given me. I really want to get ahead in life. Currently I need a loan so I can purchase additional merchandise, seeing the Christmas season is coming and during this time sales are really good. In this way, I'll be able to improve my business and quality of life and support my family, which is the important thing in my life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madam Group

texts.en:
This is the MADAM Group. All 15 members of the group are employees of MADAM. MADAM, an acronym for Mankindu's Activities for Development Accreditation Movement, is a non-governmental organization based in Makeni that promotes four major themes: (1) agriculture and food security; (2) education; (3) employment generation; and (4) skills training. MADAM recently participated in the 2008 World Food Day event in Sierra Leone alongside President Ernest Bai K.. Together, they are requesting a loan for 14,900,000 LE.

The leader of the MADAM Group is Mohamed C. (back row, third from left). Mohamed is 41 years of age, married, with three children who all attend primary school. Mohammedu's wife is a businesswoman. Mohamed intends to use his portion of the SMT loan to continue building his new home. Currently, Mohamed and his family rent an apartment. Completion of the new home will save Mohamed 1,500,000 LE per year in lost rental fees and will allow him to build equity in the home. The new home will also give his children better security and more freedom. Lastly, Mohamed hopes his first home is a starting point for investing in other forms of real estate.

loans.use: To build a home

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo sells wines and local gin (ogogoro) She has been in this business for over seven years. During the festive season, demands for her wine and local gin will be high. Titilayo needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more wine and local gin to sell which will help her meet the demands of customers during and after the festive season.

Titilayo is 51 years old and divorced with four children. Titilayo is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of wine and local gin

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi sells jewelry and makeup items. She has been in this business for the past five years. She also has a big deep freezer that she uses to sell drinks and bottled water. She needs the loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more jewelery and makeup items to sell. Bummi is 42 years old and married and with three children. All her children are all schooling. Bummi is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry and makeup itemsto sell

loans.name: Zonia Maria

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Zonia L. me dedico a la venta de joyeria tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, soy una persona humilde y muy trabajadora, en estos dias los enchapes y joyas de fantasia se venden mucho ya que la delincuencia esta muy dificil en nuestro pais, y las mujeres compran bastante joyeria de fantasia para que no las asalten y siempre andar hermosas en sus trabajos, tambien por el costo de cada pieza que es mucho mas barato que una original, tengo muchas clientes en casi todos los bancos, y ellas me estan pidiendo mucho producto ya que viene la epoca navideña y estos productos se venden mucho, necesito el credito para poder comprar un lote grande y asi poder mejorar mi negocio que es mi unica fuente de ingresos que tengo.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Zonia L.. I sell jewelry. I've been doing this for several years. I am a very humble and hard-working person. Currently earrings and costume jewelry are selling quite well, seeing crime is a difficult problem right now in our country, and women purchase a lot of costume jewelry to avoid attack and to still look good at work. In addition, the cost of each piece is much less than a real piece. I have a lot of clients who work in banks and they are ordering a lot of products because the Christmas season is coming and because these products are very popular. I need a loan to be able to purchase a large shipment and, in this way, be able to improve my business, which is my only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en:
Oluwakemi has a business where she sells drinks, bottled sachet water and eggs to her retail customers. She has been in this business for the past five years.

Oluwakemi has been borrowing from LAPO MICROFINANCE for the past three years. She has never defaulted and not repayed her loan.

Oluwakemi needs a loan of N70,000 so she can purchase more crates of drinks and eggs to sell.

She is 35 years old. She is married with three children. Her children are in primary and nursery school. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Damilola

texts.en:
Damilola sells hair extensions. She has been in this business for the past six years.

She is a LAPO client.

Damilola purchases hair extensions in the wholesale market and sells them to her retail customers.

Damilola now needs a loan of N70,000 so she can purchase more hair extensions to sell. She is happy because during the festive season the demand for her hair extensions is high.

Damilola is 59 years old. She is divorced and she has four children. She and her children live in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Fredy G. me dedico a la venta de ropa clasificada, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, este negocio me ha permitido ayudarle a mi esposo con todos los gastos de nuestro hogar y gracias a Dios hemos salido adelante, yo soy una persona muy dedicada a mi negocio y tengo muchas ganas de salir adelante, le doy graias a Dios por todo lo que tengo y lo bueno que ha sido con mi familia. en estos momentos necesito el credito para poder incrementar mi inventario ya que en esta espoca las ventas soy muy grandes y necesito tener bien surtido mi negocio para complacer todas las exigencias de mis clientes.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Fredy G.. I sell brand name clothing, a business I have been running for many years. It has permitted me to help my husband with the household expenses and thanks be to God that we have pulled through. I am a person very dedicated to my business and I have a great drive to be a success. I thank God for everything that I have and all the good that has come to my family. Currently I require a loan so that I may replenish my inventory. Especially during this season when sales are so high I need to have my business wel stocked to fulfill the demands of my clientele.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Quadri

texts.en: Quadri sells spiritual items like incense, olive oils, crucifixes, and candles, etc. She supplies churches and individuals. She has been in this business for the past five years. Quadri is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are undergoing a vocational training while the other two are in school. She needs the loan amount N50, 000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells chicken and also supplies eggs to her customers. Deborah has been in this business for the past two years. Before that, she was selling second-hand clothes but business was not moving well so she switched to the poultry business. Deborah needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more poultry birds in large quantities at a reduced price. This, she said, will enable her to meet the demands of customers as the festive season is fast approaching.

Deborah lives in Lagos state with her entire family; she is 45 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose B. soy una persona que me dedico al comercio desde hace mucho tiempo, esta actividad me ha permitido crecer economicamente y hemos logrado con mi esposa salir adelante con nuestro hogar y nuestros hijos, tenemos 3 hijos que son lo mas importante en mi vida, gracias a Dios hemos podido darles alimento, educacion y otras necesidades, en estos momentos necesito el credito para surtir mas mi negocio ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas y ya me estan pidiendo producto para navidad, entonces me estoy quedando si producto ya que casi todo lo tengo encargado. tengo muchas ganas de salir adelante y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Jose B.. I have been a businessman for a long time. My business activities have allowed me to grow financially, and my wife and I have managed to get ahead with our home and our children. We have three children who are the most important thing in my life. Thanks to God, we have been able to feed them, given them an education and provide for other necessities. Currently I need a loan to provide additional stock for my business, seeing my clients' demands are great and they are ordering a lot of products for Christmas. As such, I'm currently out of stock and I have almost everything on order. I really want to get ahead and make my business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes and backpacks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola has a bakery business. She sells bread to shops in her neighbouring community. She has a vehicle which she uses to deliver the bread. Ola has been in this business for the past three years.

She is a LAPO client.

She now needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more bread to sell.

Ola is 37 years old and married to Mr. K.. He works at an insurance firm. They have three lovely children who attend a private primary school.

She says thank you and promises to repay her kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 42 years old. She is married with two children.

She and her family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client.

Bola sells provisions such as drinks and bottled water. She has been running this business for the past three years.

She now needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex T. M. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through primary level. Alex sells groceries like Milo, milk and other things at Kissi near Elmina, which he has done since 2006. His wife is a trader. Alex uses his income to take care of the family's financial needs. Alex will use the loan to purchase more Milo, milk, sugar and others things for his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Alex plans to invest in his children's education.

loans.use: Alex will use the loan to purchase more Milo, milk, sugar and others items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Alelí Village Bank. She is married and has two daughters, a four-year-old and a newborn baby. She and her husband own a motorcycle taxi, which her husband drives, as well as a carpentry shop, where he works when he is not driving the taxi. They opened the workshop a year and a half ago, prior to which her husband worked for a public agency in Ayacucho. He usually works by himself, but when he receives large orders he hires workers. 

Nancy is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy wood for the workshop. She and her husband work mainly with tornillo (an inexpensive wood found in South America) and sometimes with oak, depending on the order. She will also use part of the money to repair the motorcycle taxi. 

Nancy has been working with FINCA for about a year. She says it has taught her to be more responsible and more of a humanist. The microloans have been a big help for her family.

loans.use: Buy wood and repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Gabriela Soledad

texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Alelí Village Bank.

Gabriela is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are 19, 16, 9 and 3 years old. She sells hamburgers from a vending cart, but would like to open up a restaurant. Her hamburgers are homemade and sell very well, so she expects to have a lot of customers.

Gabriela is requesting a loan of 1750 soles to buy tables and chairs for the restaurant. She has already found a space to use in a high-traffic area on Manco Capac Street in the center of the city of Ayacucho.

This is Gabriela’s third loan cycle with the Alelí Village Bank. She says that FINCA has helped her by providing her with easily accessible investment capital. She finds the training/education sessions provided by her loan officer to be very helpful, and says that her work with FINCA has taught her to be punctual. She has almost 1000 soles in her FINCA savings account, and says she never would have saved this much were it not for the help of the institution. 

Gabriela’s dream is to eventually open up a soda fountain-style restaurant that would be open all day and sell cakes, pastries, and coffee in addition to meals.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for restaurant

loans.name: Melitón

texts.es:
Con 6 años invertidos en el negocio de los mototaxis (conduce uno), el señor Melitón cuenta con 50 años de edad. El señor ve imperiosa su necesidad económica y la de su hija de 19 años, con quien vive en casa, por lo cual se dedica también a la música en una peña, todo esto en pos de solventar sus necesidades básicas así como la educación superior de su hija. Es más que ardua su labor como mototaxista, partiendo con el amanecer y llegando a casa pasada la medianoche, pero siempre pasando por casa para dejar para el almuerzo y pasajes a la Universidad de su hija, haciendo más que loable su labor. Tanto esfuerzo le causa los réditos necesarios para dichas necesidades pero esconde la escasez de tiempo que tiene para con su hija, lo cual afecta mucho al señor Melitón.

En pro de volver más rentable su trabajo como mototaxista, el señor Melitón requiere de 500 soles de préstamo, lo que le sumaría tiempo para pasar con su hija.
texts.en:
Meliton is 50 years old, and has invested the last 6 years in the mototaxi business (he drives one). Meliton sees his tough financial situation and in addition to driving the mototaxi, he also works as a musician to support his household expenses and his 19-year-old daughter's college education. As a mototaxi driver, Meliton works long hours: he leaves home at dawn, and comes back after midnight, but he always drives by home at lunch time to leave money for his daughter's meals and transportation to the university, which makes his efforts even more commendable. These long work days do produce enough income to cover Meliton's expenses, but he has little time to spend with his daughter, which leaves him with a heavy heart. Meliton is requesting a loan of 500 soles to purchase enough fuel for the motor taxi, and to have a contingency plan for repairs. Having this money available now will make it possible for Meliton to have some free time to spend with his daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fuel for mototaxi and have spare funds to cover repairs

loans.name: Lluvia De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Lluvia de Noviembre todas somos comerciantes, tenemos mucho tiempo de conocernos y somos muy amigas, una caracteristica principal de nuestro grupo es que somos muy trabajadoras y honrradas. nuestro grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Elsa S.: soy la coordinadora del grupo mi actividad principal es el comercil, me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo una pequeña pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacion, soy madre soltera y gracias a mi negocio puedo sostener mi hogar,.
Yaris S.: ella se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, esto le permite no descuidar a sus hijos.
Belinda F.: la actividad de ella es la venta de cosmeticos, los vende de manera ambulante y por encargo, ella es casada y tiene el apoyo del esposo para los gastos del hogar.
todas nosotras necesitamos el credito para mejorar nuestros negocios y asi salir adelante con nuestras familias.,
texts.en:
Hello. We are the group “Lluvia de Noviembre” (“November Rain”). We are all merchants, have known each other for a long time and are good friends. A primary characteristic of our group is that we are very hard-working and honest. Our group is comprised as follows: Elsa S.: I am the coordinator of the group. My principal activity is commercial, and I dedicate myself to selling popular consumer products. I have a small grocery store located in my home, am a single mother, and thanks to my business I can support my household. Yaris S.: Is dedicated to commerce, having a business selling candies. Her business is located in her home which allows her to care for her children. Belinda F.: Her activity involves the sale of cosmetics which she sells door-to-door and also on order. She is married and has the support of her husband with the household expenses. All of us need the loan to help our businesses and, in that manner, get ahead along with our families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rony Ranfieri

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Rony O., soy casado mi actividad principal es la joyeria, cuento con un negocio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, tengo muchos años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad ya que desde niño inicie con esta labor porque mis padres siempre tuvieron esta joyeria y ahora que es mia necesito inyectarle un buen capital para sacarla adelante, cuento con una muy buena clientela. este negocio es mi unica fuente de ingresos para cubrir con loas gastos de mi hogar, de mi dependen mi esposa y mi hijo.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Rony O.. I am married. My work primarily consists of selling jewelry. I own a business located downtown. I have been in this business for many years after getting a start as a child when my parents owned this jewelry store. Now that I own the store, I need to invest some capital in order to help it succeed. I have a good client base. This business is my only source of income for covering my household expenses and for supporting my wife and son.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and base materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Propiass Group

texts.es: LAS INTEGRANTES GRUPO "LAS PROPIASS"  ESTÁN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA ISABEL, ELLAS INTEGRAN UN GRUPO D. SEÑORAS RESPONSABLES QUE MANEJAN BIEN SU TIEMPO Y SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO PARA PODER ESTAR EN UN BUEN LUGAR CON SUS CRÉDITOS, ES ASÍ QUE ESTE GRUPO NO A TENIDO MAYORES PERCANCE EN LOS PAGOS EN ANTERIORES FINANCIAMIENTOS, EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO Y VENTA D. PRODUCTOS COMO EL  PAN, GAS, ROPA Y COSMÉTICOS ALGUNOS D. LOS SOCIOS SE DEDICAN AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO EN MOTO TAXIS, CHAPARÍA Y PINTURA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN ESTA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA D. MATERIALES, HERRAMIENTAS Y AL AUMENTO D. MERCADERÍA PARA LA VENTA, LA CUAL SUBE A FIN D. AÑO POR LAS FIESTAS D. NAVIDAD.
texts.en:
The group members of "Las Propiass" are represented by Isabel. They are members of a group of responsible women who manage their time and their working capital well so that they can be in good standing with their loans. It is this way that this group has not had a major mishap with their payments from previous financings. For the most part, they are dedicated to traD. and selling products like bread, gas, clothing and cosmetics. Some of the members work in public transport with mototaxis, auto body work and painting. The loan granted by the foundation will go toward the purchase of materials, tools, and to augment merchandise for sales, which increase at the end of the year due to the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Money for operations.

loans.name: Roy Eduardo

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Roy M., tengo un taller de estructuras metalicas en donde fabrico puertas, marcos, ventanas, portones etc. en estos momentos tengo varios proyectos pero son grandes y me falta un poco de capital para comprar material y asi cubrir con todo lo especificado, por tal razon estoy solicitando el credito. de mi dependen mi familia que es lo mas importante en mi vida.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Roy M.. I have a workshop for metal structures where I make doors, frames, windows, gates, etc. Currently I have various projects, but they are large and I need a little capital to purchase materials and, in this way, meet all the specifications. For this reason I am requesting a loan. I support my family, which is the most important thing in my life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Andantes 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "LAS ANDANTES 2" esta representado por la señora Guadalupe, sus integrantes son gente responsable que trabaja unida para sacar adelante a sus familias y sobresalir como un buen grupo D. trabajo, los socios se dedican a actidades D. comercio como a la venta D. carne, verdura, frutas y abarrotes algunos tienen actividades como la costura y la pintura son gente emprendedora y responsable ya que mantienen a sus familias con su trabajo. los miembros del grupo participaron en el anterior ciclo en su mayoría por lo que tiene experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios e incentivan a las  integrantes nuevas a ser personas responsables en sus pagos. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. insumo para la venta y compra D. materiales y herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Las Andantes 2 community bank is represented by Sra. Guadalupe. Its members are responsible people who work together to improve the lives of their families and to excel as a team. They own various businesses selling products such as meat, vegetables, fruits and groceries and services such as dress-making and painting. They're hard-working and responsible because they support their families with their businesses. Most of the group's members joined the last [borrowing] cycle so they have experience working together and they offer incentives to new members to be responsible borrowers. The purpose of the loan is to fund the purchase of goods for resale and work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Tropical Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal TROPICAL esta representado por la señora Jenny, las socias ya tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios ya que en su mayoría estuvieron en el anterior financiamiento otorgado, en el cual se detectaron algunos retrasos en el plan de pagos,  pero el espíritu de las personas mas responsables hizo que el grupo salga adelante y no se dieran por vencidas por una mala experiencia, pues ahora enfrentan un nuevo desafío al sentirse capaz de continuar trabajando con la institución, Todas son madres de familia dedicadas al comerciantes de diferentes productos como ser: ropa, cosméticos, comida , condimentos, refrescos, verduras y productos de la época algunas tiene sus puestos de venta fijos y otros son vendedores ambulantes. Son personas responsables y con experiencia en sus diferentes actividades. El destino del financiamiento es el incremento de insumos y materiales en especial para la época navideña que es cuando existe mayor movimiento en el mercado de venta de productos.
texts.en:
The Tropical Communal Bank is represented by Mrs. Jenny. The members already have experience with supportive groups, as most of them were part of the last loan they received. There were some late payments, but the spirit of the most responsible people of the group helped keep them going and they were not defeated by a bad experience. Now they are confronting a new challenge and feel capable of continuing to work with the communal bank. All of the members are mothers dedicated to selling various products such as clothing, cosmetics, food, condiments, soft drinks, vegetables, and seasonable products. Some have permanent sales stalls and others are street vendors. This loan will be used to buy ingredients and materials, in particular for the Christmas season, which is when the market is the busiest and sells the most products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guadalupitas Group

texts.es: LAS  PERSONAS QUIENES CONFORMAN EL GRUPO "GUADALUPITAS" ESTAN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA MARI LUZ, TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES SON PERSONAS DEDICADAS AL COMERCIO Y  ADEMÁS  SE CONOCEN HACE MUCHOS AÑOS YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO. TODOS LOS SOCIOS SON GENTE RESPONSABLE, SOLIDARIA Y SE COMPROMETEN A SER PUNTUALES EN LOS PAGOS D. LAS CUOTAS. LOS SOCIOS SE DEDICAN A VARIADAS ACTIVIDADES COMO SER: VENTA D. ROPA, PRODUCTOS COSMESTICO, VENTA D. COMIDA, D. VERDURA, FRUTAS, LICORERIA, ABARROTE. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO POR LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA EN ESPECIAL EN LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS, PERO LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA Y ANTIGUEDAD EN SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA POR LO QUE NO TIENEN MAYOR DIFICULTAD CON LA COMPETENCIA. TODOS ELLOS DESEAN SUPERARSE Y SALIR ADELANTE CON SUS FAMILIAS ES POR ESO QUE TODOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACION AGROCAPITAL SERÁ DESTINADO PARA AUMENTAR INSUMOS A SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA Y MEJORAR EN LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Guadalupitas" are represented by Maria Luz. All of them work in sales and have known each other for years because they live in the same area. They all are responsible, caring, and committed to make their payments on time. Their businesses incluD. the sale of clothing, household products, food, vegetables, fruits, groceries. The "Guadalupitas", like everyone else in sales, face competition in the market, but they are all experienced and hard working, and have no trouble doing well. All of them wish to do better and make a better life for their families. The loan requested will be used to restock their businesses and to improve the quality of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ramón Antonio P. G. el originario del departamento de Totonicapan dicho pueblo se encuentra  a 210 Kilomestro de la ciudad capital principamente el la region del occidente del pais un publo con la elegancia de los bosque naturales conocido como el de los pinos y de las manzanas el desde cuando era niño aprencio el oficio de la crianza y al destazo de los cerdos y a la venta de la carne de marrano y sus derivados, con su querido padre que en paz descanse. El dia a dia queria hacer su propio negocio  la cual lo logro hoy necesita que la institucion ASDIR lo apoye con un prestamo para aumentar su capital. En esta epocas de fin de año dicho producto es comercializado  en la ciudad de Guatemala por las fiestas de fin de año y la cual el quiere aprobechar esa oportunida y con ello mejor su calidad de vida y la de sufamilia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramon Antonio P. G. is a native of the Totonicapan province, located 210 Km. from the capital city in the western part of the country. The area is graced by natural forest known for its pine trees and apples. From the time he was a boy Mr. P. G. learned the trade of raising and butchering pigs, and the sale of pork and pork products, from his beloved father, who has passed away. He had always wanted to start his own business, which he has succeeded in doing. Now he is seeking a loan from ASDIR in order to increase his capital. During the end-of-year season he sells his products in Guatemala City for the New Year’s Eve festivities. He hopes he will be able to take advantage of this opportunity so he can improve the quality of life for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise Capital

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: LOS SOCIOS DEL GRUPO "SANTA ROSA D. LIMA" REPRESENTADA POR LA PRESIDENTA SEÑORA NIVERY NAGAKO LA CUAL ES HERMANA D. MARÍA ABIGAIL, POR OTRO LADO LA SEÑORA JULIA  ES MADRE D. LA SEÑORA FABIOLA  ESTOS SERIAN LOS DOS CASOS NEXOS CONSANGUÍNEOS DENTRO DEL GRUPO PERO ELLO NO REPRESENTA NINGÚN PROBLEMA YA QUE CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENE SUS INGRESOS D. MANERA INDEPENDIENTE.  LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, PROMOTORAS D. AVON, YAMBAL,  VENTA D. ROPA, , VENTA D. TORTAS Y PASTELES  EN EL CASO D. LAS TRECE MUJERES, EL ÚNICO VARÓN DEL GRUPO TIENE UNA CARPINTERÍA EN LA CUAL REALIZA MUEBLES A PEDIDO. SEGÚN EXPRESIONES D. LAS SOCIAS EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO ES PARA LA AMPLIACIÓN D. SUS NEGOCIOS,  Y PODER INCREMENTAR HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO EN CASO D. LOS VARONES. LA MAYORÍA D. LAS SOCIAS HAN TRABAJADO CON FUNDACIONES O ORGANIZACIONES FINANCIERAS POR LO QUE YA TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPO SOLIDARIOS. POR LO QUE RESPECTA A LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL LAS SOCIAS PERTENECEN AL PRIMER CICLO.
texts.en:
The members of the “Santa Rosa D. Lima” group are represented by their president, Mrs. Nivery Nagako, and incluD. her sister, Maria Abigail, as well as Mrs. Fabiola and her mother, Mrs. Julia. While there are two sets of relatives within this group, this is not a problem, as each member has her own income. The thirteen female members make their living selling food, Avon and Yambal products, clothing, sandwiches and cakes. The only man in the group has a carpentry business and makes custom furniture. The ladies in the group plan to use the loan to expand their business. The men would like to acquire more tools. Most of the members have worked with financial foundations and organizations before, so they already have experience in supportive groups. This is their first loan with Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Demetrio Nicolas

texts.es: Demetrio Nicolas C. P. es Originario del departamento de Totonicapan con residencia en la Aldea Nimasac Totonicapan desde varios años aprendio el oficio de ser talabartero, hace diez años decidio hacer su propio taller y hacer su propio negocio. Que hasta la fecha todo le va muy bien don Nicolas se visita las oficinas de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para aumenta su capital y su propio negocio en la busca de otros mercados como Mazatenango, Quetzaltengo y con ello se ve la necesidad de surtir su mercaderia con varios productos. calzado para damas y caballeros, Niñas Ñinos.y como la compra de materia prima y maquinaria que le permite competir en el mercado y que le facilite la elaboracion  del calzado.
texts.en:
Demetrio Nicolas C. P. is originally from the department of Totonicapan, residing in the Nimasac Totonicapan village for several years. Over time, he learned the craft of handmade leather goods. Ten years ago, he decided to set up a workshop and start his own business. To this day, all has gone well and he visited the offices of ASDIR to request a loan to increase his working capital. He also wants to increase his business by expanding to other markets such as Mazatenango and Quetzaltengo. To do this, he finds himself having to increase his merchandise supply with various products such as men’s, women’s and children’s shoes. The loan will help him purchase the raw materials and machinery that allow him to compete in the market, and will facilitate his production of footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. A. trabaja con Emprender desde el año 2007, fue recomendado por una cliente 
muy buena y antigua de la institución. Es transportista y su esposa es tejedora de mantas, juntos cuidan con mucho cariño de dos niños pequeño que a su vez colaboran en las labores del hogar. El  motivo de este crédito fue el de consefguir liquidez económica para la reparación de su vehiculo; el Sr. Andres siempre ha cumplido con sus pagos en forma responsable.
texts.en:
Andres A. has been with Emprender since the year 2007. He was recommended by an existing client who is with the institution for many years. He works in transportation and his wife knits crafts, and together they take care of their two little children with much love, all the while collaborating together on household matters. The reason for this loan is to gain working capital to repair his vehicle. Andres A. has always been responsibly on time with his payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El sr. Benedicto trabaja con la institución desde hace un año, es propietario de un salón de billar en su zona, donde atiende todos los días por las tardes; comparte los gastos de la casa con su esposa, quien tiene un restaurante muy cercano al salón de billar, tienen un bebé, son muy unidos y trabajadores. Viven en un pequeño departamento lo suficientemente amplio para ellos y su bebé. El crédito será invertido en la compra de canchitas (futbolines)  y una mesa de ping pong, ya que el salón es grande y tiene espacio para estos juegos. Es un cliente muy responsable.
texts.en:
Benedicto has been with the institution for the past year. He is the owner of a pool hall in his region, managing it daily in the afternoons. He shares the expenses with hsi wife who own a restaurant very close the the pool hall. They have a baby together. They are a very close couple and they are hard workers. They live in a smal apartment, only big enough for themselves and the baby. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a foosball table and a ping pong table. The pool hall is large and there is room still for these games. He is a very responsible client.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ping pong tables.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes R. R. is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank, which means “steadiness” in Spanish. She is married, has two children, and works everyday selling food. She will use her loan of 600 soles to purchase potatoes, seafood, and limes. She is currently saving to be able to pay for her children’s education so they can become professionals. Her dream is to have her children remain in school and become professionals and that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Buy potatoes, seafood, and limes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank; "firmeza" means “steadiness” in Spanish.  Sonia is married, with three children. With the help of her husband and children, she runs a book store with 8 computers that have internet access. She will use her loan to purchase books, pens, greeting cards and notebooks. With the savings she has accumulated she hopes that the interest will continue to grow. Her dream is to build her own house in Ayacucho.

loans.use: Buy books, pens, greeting cards and notebooks

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, para la construcción de una habitación, trabaja en el INSS como analista de prestaciones desde hace 14 años, tiene 2 hijos: el mayor de 9 años estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria y el menor de 2 añitos de edad; Xiomara es madre soltera y asume el rol de madre y padre para sus hijos, es una profesional muy responsable, honesta, con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral,  que ama su trabajo, ademas es muy trabajadora y lucha para que a sus hijos no le falte lo basico en el hogar.  Vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea en la zona # 8, este barrio recientemente se poblo y cada día se va aumentando su población, el mayor sueño de Xiomara  es estudiar el proximo año una maestría,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  bonita para así pasarse a vivir en su nueva casa,  se siente agradecida con AFODENIC, ya que con los créditos anteriores logro construir poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara is seeking refinancing of a 5th loan so she can invest in improvements to her home by adding a room. She has worked for INSS as a benefits analyst for 14 years. She has two children: the oldest is 9 and in the 2nd grade of elementary school; the youngest is 2-years-old. Xiomara is a single mother and assumes the role of mother and father to her children. She is a very responsible and honest professional, and has a strong desire for self-improvement, both personally and professionally. She loves her work, is very hard-working and strives to see that her children lack for none of the essentials in their home. She lives in the urban area of New Guinea, in Zone #8, a new neighborhood whose population grows daily. Xiomara’s greatest dream is to study next year for her master’s degree, have stability, health, a nice home, and to begin living in her new house. She feels very appreciative of AFODENIC, since with prior loans she has succeeded in building her home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of 1 home

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La sra. Filomena trabaja tres años en la institución, empezó a solicitar créditos mediante un grupo solidario, sin embargo al necesitar mayor capital que el disponible en el grupo se independizó, tiene una tienda D. barrio, es muy conocida por su zona, es casada, su esposo trabaja como transportista público, y sus hijos ya son mayores, cada uno independiente. La sra. invertirá en la compra D. mercadería para la tienda, como ser arroz, fideo, harina, azúcar por quintal, y bebidas, panetones y chocolates para las fiestas D. fin D. año. Es una cliente muy puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Filomena has worked with the institution for three years, previously having obtained loans through an independent group. Regardless, upon needing greater capital than was available in the group, she moved forward on her own. She has a small neighborhood store and is very well-known in her area. She is married, her husband working in public transportation. Her children are now grown, each one on their own. Filomena will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, sodas, and panettones (small bread loaves containing raisins and candied fruit) and chocolates for the holidays. She is a very punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en: Flor is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank; "firmeza" means “solidarity” in Spanish.  Flor has a restaurant/café on one of the busiest streets in Ayacucho where she works with the help of her sister and mother. She helps cook most meals and helps to run the business. The menu offers traditional Peruvian dishes. She will use her loan to purchase groceries for the restaurant including, chicken, sausages, noodles, corn and rice. Her dream, and the reason she is saving, is to open another café.

loans.use: Buy groceries for restaurant

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank; "firmeza" means “steadiness” in Spanish. She is married, with two children and runs her own beverage and bread cart. With her loan she will invest in her business by purchasing various groceries, including gum, cookies, candies, drinks, flour, sugar and eggs.  Her dream, and the reason she is saving, is to be able to keep her store filled with products that her customers desire and to have another business.

loans.use: Buy gum, cookies, candy, drinks, flour, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is married, with two children. One of her children is studying at the local University. Rufina runs a small grocery store. With her loan, Rufina will invest in her store by purchasing groceries including sugar, oil, candies, gum and water.  She is currently saving to fulfill her dream of sending her children to the university to become professionals. She also wants to maintain and continue growing her business.

loans.use: Buy sugar, oil, candy, gum and water

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a single mother of two children. She sells candies daily while walking in the main plaza. With her loan she will invest into her business by purchasing gum, candy and cigarettes.  Cirila is currently saving so she can purchase things that she might need in the future. She hopes that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Gum, candy and cigarettes

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO " BONANZA " ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARLENE QUIEN ES SU PRESIDENTA. DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTE UN PARENTESCO CONSANGUÍNEO ENTRE LA  SEÑORA YANNETH Y SU HIJA EMILENE PERO AMBAS TIENEN INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES POR LO QUE NO REPRESENTA UN PROBLEMA EN EL GRUPO. EN GENERAL LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS COMO SER: VENTA D. ROPA, COMIDA ,COSMÉTICOS Y UNO D. LOS SOCIOS TRABAJA EN SERIGRAFÍA, TIENE ALGUNAS HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO PERO NO ES INDEPENDIENTE, ESTE ES UNO D. LOS MOTIVOS POR EL QUE QUIERE EL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA PODER INDENDIZARSE Y ABRIR SU PROPIO NEGOCIO CON LA EXPERIENCIA D. HABER TRABAJADO CINCO AÑOS EN EL RUBRO. COMO EN TODO ACTIVIDAD COMERCIAL SIEMPRE HAY COMPETENCIA PERO CON LA ANTIGÜEDAD Y LAS GANAS D. CRECER EN EL TRABAJO SABEN QUE PODRÁN SALIR ADELANTE. EL GRUPO  MANIFIESTA QUE EL CRÉDITO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL SERÁ DESTINADO PARA MEJORAR SUS ACTIVIDADES O AUMENTAR CAPITAL. ALGUNA D. LAS SOCIAS COMENTAN QUE YA TIENEN EXPERIENCIA TRABAJANDO CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS Y SABEN D. LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE IMPLICA UN PRÉSTAMO.
texts.en:
The “Bonanza” group is represented by Mrs. Marlene, their president. The group includes relatives Yanneth and her daughter Emilene, but each has her own income, so this does not present any problem to the group. The members make their living selling different products, including clothing, food, and cosmetics. One member works in screen-printing and has some tools but is not independent, which is one reason for his seeking financing. He would like to gain independence and open his own business with the experience he has gained in 5 years of work in his field. As in all business, there is always competition, but with their experience and desire to grow the business, the members know that they can advance. The group says that the loan they receive from the Agrocapital Foundation will be used to improve their business and grow capital. One member notes that the members already have experience working in supportive groups with other financial organizations and know the responsibility that comes with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Rosa Leonidas

texts.en: Rosa is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a widow with five children. She works daily at her grocery store which is located in her house. With her loan, she will invest in her business by purchasing various groceries including gum, candy, soda, bottles of water, soap, laundry detergent, cookies and cooking oil.  Rosa currently saves to send her children to school so they will eventually become professionals and she also dreams that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: Buy gum, candy, soda, water, soap, cookies and oil

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva is a member of community bank, Violeta. Genoveva is married and has 7 children who are all in school. With the help of her husband, Genoveva has her business selling dried goods and vegetables. She travels to the rainforest to sell her goods. With her loan, she will invest in her business by purchasing wheat, corn, flour, carrots and limes.  Genoveva is saving to be able to continue working and fulfill her dreams of owning her own truck to haul her products to sell at various locations.

loans.use: Buy wheat, corn, flour, carrots and limes

loans.name: Janet Magda

texts.es: La Sra. Janet T. empiezó a trabajar desde muy joven con su mamá vendiendo caramelos de manera ambulante; más adelante y ya casada, decide abrir una pequeña tienda en el domicilio de sus padres desde hace cuatro años; desde entonces ella, su esposo y sus hijos tienen un ingreso extra para la familia. Actualmente su hijo esta graduándose de policía y quiere que sus ahorros estén disponibles para cuando sus hijos los necesiten.
texts.en:
Ms. Janet T. started working together with her mom, a candies street vendor, since she was very young. Four years ago, once married, she decided to open a little store at her parent's home. Ever since, she has been able to provide her sons and husband with an extra income. She is about to graduate as a policewoman and she wants her savings to be available whenever her kids will need them.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.  Alejandra is married, with two children. She has her own business, where she works daily selling groceries and running a lunch counter. With her loan, she will invest in her business with the purchase of corn, carrots, lemons, cooking oil and bottled water.  Alejandra is currently saving to ensure her children are educated and she also wants to continue moving ahead and succeeding with her work.

loans.use: Buy corn, carrots, lemons, cooking oil and bottled water

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.en: Nancy is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. Nancy is married and has two children. With a little help from her children, Nancy runs a multi-service shop. In her shop, customers can make photocopies, use the public telephone and purchase groceries. With her loan, she will invest in her business by purchasing groceries, printer paper and toner for the copy machines.  Nancy is currently saving to ensure her children remain in the school and continue studying. She also hopes she can continue the growth of her business.

loans.use: Buy grocieries, printer paper and toner

loans.name: Lizette

texts.en: Lizette is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a single mother with one son. She works, daily, in a glass factory with various members of her family including her husband. She will use her loan to invest into the family business by purchasing fire wood, which will be delivered to the factory. Lizette is currently saving to fulfill her dream of building her own house. She would also like to continue improving her business.

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia tiene 38 años de edad y 9 en la venta de pollos en un mercado cercano a su casa. En detrimento de su negocio va la actual coyuntura económica, pero no ha visto decaer sus ingresos, gracias a la calidad de los productos que adquiere de los mayoristas a primera hora diariamente. Al construirse un sitial reconocido por los clientes en el Mercado “27 de octubre”, logra ser el sostén económico en casa, donde vive con su esposo e hijo de 21 años. Pero sabe que nada le garantiza que el mañana sea así, por lo cual diseña sus estrategias para fortalecer su negocio y sabe que una de las aristas principales de éste es la inversión, el capital que uno pueda tener.

En aras de poder mantenerse como uno de los puestos líderes del mercado donde labora, requiere del préstamo de 2000 soles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Basilia is 38 years old and for 9 years she has been selling chickens in a market near her house. The current economic climate has been a detriment to her business, but she has not seen her income decline thanks to the quality of the products that she buys, from wholesalers in the early hours of the day, in order to build a spot recognizable by the clients in Market "October 27" and to act as the main source of income in the house where she lives with her husband and her 21-year-old son. But she knows that there are no guarantees that tomorrow will be the same. So she develops strategies to strengthen her business and she knows that one of the main ways is through investment. The money that one is able to have. In order to remain one of the leaders in the market where she works, she requires a loan of 2000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Con 16 años de experiencia en la venta de locería, regalos (una especie de boutique) y con todo este año de implementado un local en el Mercado “27 de noviembre” de cabinas de Internet, la señora Hilda, de 45 años, es toda una lideresa cuando a negocios se refiere. Dada su tremenda responsabilidad como madre y padre, tiene 4 hijos (de 21, 17, 15 y 12 años de edad), los 2 mayores en la Universidad y los otros 2 en el colegio, es que realiza tan denodado esfuerzo, sabe que es el soporte de sus 4 hijos. Fruto de tal esfuerzo, la señora Hilda ha logrado ambientar uno de sus locales que lo alquilaba, ahora convertido, o complementando, en una boutique.

Para seguir emprendiendo tan dura labor y responsabilidad para con sus hijos, la señora Hilda necesita de 3000 soles, en aras de poder seguir dándoles tan dicha educación.
texts.en:
With 16 years´ experience in the sale of china and gifts (in a type of boutique) and this year having started up an Internet café in the "27 de noviembre" market, Hilda, 45 years old, is a business leader. Given her tremendous responsibility as both mother and father to 4 children (who are 21, 17, 15 and 12 years old), the 2 oldest in university and the other 2 in school, she makes a brave effort knowing that she is the only support for her children. As a result of this effort, Hilda has been able to convert one of the premises she rented into a boutique. In order to keep taking on such hard work and the responsibility of her children Hilda needs 3000 soles, so that she can continue to give them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish setting up her boutique and stocking it with inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. She is a single mother of two and has her own business selling popcorn. With her loan, she will purchase corn, butter and sugar.  Alicia is saving to ensure her children remain in school to become professionals. She would also like to improve her business and purchase a small cart to sell popcorn.

loans.use: Buy corn, butter and sugar to make popcorn

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco S. T., guatemalteco, de 44 años de edad, casado, del Sector A-07 del paraje Chiambrocio, Cantón Chotacaj, Totonicapán,  él se dedica al comercio desde sus 32 años de edad, iniciando con un pequeño capital, ahora con la ayuda de su esposa María Graciela Velásquez Chuc han decidido agrandar el negocio para que así puedan mantener a la familia y también tener comodidades. Por tal motivo necesitan la ayuda de ASDIR para poder agrandar el negocio. Con el credito le permite compra materia prima, herramientas para producir mas y que le facilite el trabajo y ser competitivo, en el mercado y aprobechar las fiesta de fin de año y como la fiesta de la comunidad en el mes de Enero dos mil nueve  y como el inicio del nuevo ciclo escolar.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco S. T. is 44 years old and lives in Guatemala. He lives in the A-07 sector of Chiambrocio, Chotacaj County, Totonicapán. He has worked in his business since he was 32 years old and began with a small amount of capital. Now with the help of his wife María Graciela Velásquez Chuc, they have decided to expand the business so they can support their family and also have material comforts. For this reason they need ASDIR’s help to be able to expand their business. With this loan, Juan will be able to buy raw materials and tools to produce more products, to make work easier, and to be competitive in the market. He will take advantage of the coming New Year festival, the community celebration during January 2009, and the beginning of the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Con todo este año de implementada en su hogar una librería, la señora Miriam, de 43 años de edad, ha visto crecer su negocio de a pocos. Viviendo con su esposo y 3 hijos, de 20, 13 y 12 años, la señora Miriam anhela terminar de implementar su librería, dotarla de los productos necesarios para la próxima campaña escolar, sin embargo, sabe de los meses que aún restan para tal campaña, por lo cual optaría por adquirir productos alusivos a la campaña navideña para su librería, tales como juguetes, helados panetones, entre otras cosas. Y, por otro lado, es consciente de lo relevante que resulta la inversión a realizar en la compra de dichos productos.

Dada esta situación, la señora Miriam necesita de la suma de 1000 soles como préstamo, dinero que le brindaría la oportunidad de seguir escalando en cuanto a la satisfacción de sus necesidades básicas, por consiguiente, su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Having spent the year setting up a school supplies store in her home, Mrs. Miriam, 43-years-old, has seen her business grow steadily. She lives with her husband and 3 children, aged 20, 13, and 12. Miriam’s greatest wish is to complete her shop, and stock it with everything necessary for the next school year. However, she knows that this is many months away, so she will opt to stock her shop with items for the Christmas season, such as toys, ice cream, panetones, and other items. At the same time, she knows how important it is to invest in these products. In light of her situation, Mrs. Miriam needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will allow her the opportunity to continue achieving with respect to her basic needs, and in turn, her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up her school supplies store as well as acquire products to sell to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a member of the Las Hormigas Village Bank; "las hormigas" means "the ants” in Spanish. Maria is married, with two children. Maria travels to the rainforest and returns with fruit to sell at the market located near the cemetery. She also bakes and sells “wawa”, traditional bread which is celebrated during November, as the “Month of Wawa.” Maria will use her loan to buy an oven to bake wawa in. Maria plans to use her savings to pay for her daughter to attend the university. She also would like to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: Buy an oven

loans.name: Iver

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE IVER ESTÁ COMPUESTA POR DOS PERSONAS, ÉL Y SU HIJITO DE CUATRO AÑOS DE EDAD. IVER SE DEDICA AL TRANPORTE DE PASAJEROS CUENTA CON DOS VEHICULOS PARA PODER OFRECER ESTE SERVICIO. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITÓ ES PARA PODER TERMINAR  LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU DOMICILIO. SU COMPORTAMIENTO EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITOS QUE SE LE OTORGARON FUE MUY BUENO YA QUE TIENE UNA EXCELENTE CALIFICACIÓN POR LA PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS.
texts.en:
The Iver family is comprised of two people: Iver and his little son who is four years old. Iver is dedicated to passenger transportation. He has two vehicles that he uses to offer this service. The loan that he has requested is to finish the construction of his home. His behavior with previous loans that were granted to him was very good since he has excellent qualifications due to the punctuality of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Georgina Blanca

texts.en: B. is a member of community bank Las Hormigas, which means “the ants” in Spanish. Blanca is married, with four children. Blanca sells natural products and cookware with the help of her daughter. She also sells vitamins and coffee when she receives orders. She will use her loan to invest in her business by purchasing samples for her clients to ensure she always has the most up to date products.

loans.use: Buy product samples (vitamins, coffee, natural products)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE SANTOS COMPUESTA POR 5  PERSONAS: ÉL, SU CONCUBINA Y SUS TRES HIJOS QUE TIENEN 8, 6 Y 4 AÑOS RESPECTIVAMENTE. ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN UNA CASA POR LA CUÁL PAGAN ALQUILER. SANTOS ES EMPLEADO FIJO DE LA EMPRESA DE ACEITE FINO, DONDE SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL CARGO DE OPERADOR DE SOYA DESDE EL AÑO 2003. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU VIVIENDA. SUS ANTERIORES OPERACIONES FUERON CANCELADAS CON UNA BUENA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en:
There are 5 people in Santos’s family: himself, his common-law wife, and their three children, aged 8, 6, and 4. They currently live in a home which they rent. Santos has worked full-time at the Fino soybean oil factory since 2003. He plans to use his loan to purchase materials for the construction of his home. He has paid off his prior loans very responsibly and punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Carmen Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Carmela tiene 42 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia, vive en la calle Sepúlveda 755, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero se casó y ya no continuó los estudios superiores. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella porque son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su negocio lo realiza en su casa y también de manera ambulatoria, porque sale a repartir sus pedidos.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, pagó sus cuotas de los productos de belleza.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comenzará  a aumentar su stock de productos.
Carmela sueña con tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is 42 years old. She belongs to the Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia and lives on Sepúlveda Street in the Moche district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Perú. She completed high school but got married and did not continue on with her education. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are dependent on her because they are students. She sells beauty products through catalogs and conducts her business from home. She also does business outside the home because she leaves to drop off orders. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she repaid in 4 installments, she paid off her debts on the beauty products. With this loan of S./ 300, which she also plans on repaying in 4 installments, she will begin to increase her product stocks. Carmela dreams of having a successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her product stock

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cira tiene 61 años D. edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario  Santa Lucia y vive en la calle Elías Aguirre 486, distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el cuarto ciclo D. la especialidad D. Educación, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó. Tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales uno depenD. D. ella porque es estudiante.
Actualmente tiene una bodega en su casa,  en la cual venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, golosinas y cerveza para llevar.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en la tienda.
Con este crédito D. S/. 700 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en artículos D. primera necesidad.
Cira Cecilia sueña con tener un Mini Mercado.
texts.en:
Cira is 61 years old. She belongs to the Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia and lives on Elías Aguirre Street in the Moche district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Perú. She studied education at the university for four semesters but did not continue because she got married. She has 4 children, one of whom is dependent on her because she is a student. At present, she runs a grocery store out of her home, where she sells basic necessary items, sweets and beer. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she paid back in 4 installments, she invested money in the store. With this loan of S/. 700, which she also plans on repaying in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of basic necessary goods. Cira Cecilia dreams of one day owning a mini grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of basic necessary items

loans.name: Dalila Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Dalila tiene 54 años de edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en el Pasaje Jhon Kenedy 113 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria, pero se casó y ya no continuó sus estudios. Tiene 5 hijos, sólo dos dependen de ella porque son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la confección y venta de camisas y blusas, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa  y también en otras provincias.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró una máquina de coser.
Con este crédito de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará telas para hacer blusas y algunos insumos para navidad.
texts.en:
Dalila is 54 years old and the president of the communal bank “Fuente de Vida” (“Fountain of Life”). She lives in El Cortijo, Trujillo, located in the La Libertad region of Perú. She studied to the third year of secondary school, but she then married and did not complete her education. She has five children, two of whom still depend on her and are students. Her business consists of making and selling shirts and blouses, an activity she carries out in her house and also in other provinces. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, which was paid in four installments, she purchased a sewing machine. With this loan of 800.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy fabrics to make shirts as well as some supplies for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and supplies for Christmas.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana tiene 55 años D. edad, es la tesorera del Banco Comunal Fuente D. Vida y vive en la calle Chan Chan 221 sector El Cortijo, distrito y provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el segundo grado D. primaria y no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a que quedó huérfana y fue su abuelita quien se hizo cargo D. ella y D. sus hermanos, entonces desD. pequeños tuvieron que trabajar muy duro para poder sobrevivir.
Se casó muy joven y tuvo 7 hijos, D. los cuales una hija falleció a los 5 años. Actualmente tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes. Una nieta a quien cria como a una hija depenD. D. ella.
Su negocio consiste en la venta D. cerveza para ser consumida en otro lugar.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró cerveza para vender.
Con este crédito D. S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará sus envases propios e incrementará con una mayor cantidad D. cerveza.
Feliciana sueña con terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 55 years old and the treasurer of the communal bank “Fuente D. Vida” (“Fountain of Life”). She lives in El Cortijo, Trujillo, located in the La Libertad region of Perú. She studied to the second year of primary school, but was left an orphan and was unable to continue her education. Her grandmother took charge of her and her little brothers’ care. Since a young age, they’ve had to work very hard to survive. She married young and had seven children, but one daughter died at the age of five. Currently, she has six children all now grown. A niece who she raises as her own still depends on her. Her business consists of selling beer to be consumed at other locales. With the first loan of 300.00 soles, which was canceled in four payments, she purchased beer to sell. With this loan of 3,000.00, to be repaid in six months, she will buy her own bottles and will grow her business with a greater quantity of beer. Feliciana dreams of completing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase her own bottles, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Gina Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Gina tiene 35 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Vargas Llosa 104, El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer ciclo de Obstetricia, pero debido a que se casó dejó de estudiar. Tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de pan, rosquitas, pasteles, queso y manjar blanco.  Esta actividad lo realiza en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, empezó a comprar rosquitas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,400 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará juguetes para vender en Navidad.
Gina sueña con tener su casa propia y un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and belongs to the communal bank “Fuente de Vida” (“Fountain of Life”). She lives on Vargas Llosa Street in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú. She studied obstetrics, but did not finish because she got married. She has three children who still depend on her. Her business consists of selling bread, rosquitas (thin crusted breads in curved shapes), cakes, cheese, manjar blanco (dulce de leche). She realizes these activities in her house. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, which was canceled in four installments, she started to buy rosquitas. With this loan of 1,400.00 soles, to be repaid in six months, she will purchase toys to sell for Christmas. Gina dreams of having her own home and a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toys to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Grimaldina Neri

texts.es:
La señora Grimaldina tiene 50 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Chan Chan 237, El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercero de secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó y tuvo un hijo, tiempo después enviudó y actualmente tiene un segundo compromiso con el cual tiene una hija que es estudiante y depende de ella.
Anteriormente Grimaldina vendía pan, pero empezó a tener mucha competencia, entonces se cambió de actividad, la venta de menú, pero en otro sector de la ciudad, en la calle Bernardo Alcedo 140 – 1 San Fernando I etapa. 
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelados en 4 cuotas, invirtió en insumos para la venta de pan.
Con este crédito de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en insumos para la venta de menú.
Grimaldina sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Mrs Grimaldina is 50 years old. She belongs to the Communal Bank 'Fuente de Vida' and lives on the street Chan Chan 237, El Cortijo, district and province of Trujillo, region of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up until 9th grade, but did not continue studying because she had a child. Some time afterwards, she became a widow and currently is engaged. With her current partner, she has a daughter who is a student and depends on her. Before, Grimaldina sold bread, but she started to have so much competition that she switched her livelihood to sell prepared foods in a different area of the city: Bernardo Alcedo street 140-1 San Fernando I etapa. With her first loan of 300 Soles which was paid in 4 installments, she bought ingredients to sell bread. With this loan of 600 Soles, which will be paid in 4 installments, she will buy ingredients to sell full menus. Grimaldina dreams of having a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase ingredients to sell full menu foods.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 60 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Vargas Llosa 130 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de primaria, no pudo continuar estudiando debido a la situación económica de sus padres. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 3 hijos que ya son casados.
Su negocio cosiste en el alquiler de automóviles para taxi.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró pollos para criar, en aquel tiempo ese era su negocio.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en sus vehículos.
Juana sueña con tener una agencia de carros.
texts.en:
Juana is 60 years old: she belongs to the Community Bank "Life Source" and she lives in at 130 Vargas Llosa Street, in "El Cortijo", in the district and province of Tujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied up to the third grade of primary school, but could not continue studying due to her parent's economic situation. She married aged 20 and has 3 sons who are already married. Her business consists of hiring vehicles as taxis. With her first loan of 300 soles which she repaid in four installments, she bought chickens to raise, as this was her business at this time. She will invest this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments,in her cars. Juana dreams of owning a car agency.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her vehicles

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 33 años de edad, es presidenta del Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia y vive en la calle Elías Aguirre 523, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, pero al casarse ya no continuó trabajando en la profesión, prefirió dedicarse a su casa. Tiene un hijo de 9 años y percibió que es necesario su apoyo económico, entonces instaló un negocio en su casa el cual consiste en la venta de comidas a base de pescado.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró gaseosas para incrementar el negocio.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará gaseosa, servicio, banquitos e insumos para una comida que está programada de una institución.
Juana sueña con tener un gran restaurante con atención especializada.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is 33 years of age, is the president of the Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia, and lives on the Elías Aguirre 523 Street, district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied executive secretarial skills, but upon marriage she stopped working in that profession, preferring to stay home. She has a 9 year-old son and understood that her economic support is necessary so she started a business in her home that consists of selling food, mostly fish dishes. With the first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 payments, she bought sodas to increase her business. With this loan of 1,000 Soles ($325) which she will repay in 4 payments, she will buy sodas, service, stools, and supplies for fare that is set up for an establishment. Juana dreams of having a grand restaurant with specialized service.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sodas, service, stools and supplies to fill orders.

loans.name: Lola Maqueda

texts.es:
La señora Lola Maqueda P. G. tiene 42 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Chan Chan 589 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Cursó hasta el cuarto año de secundaria y no continuó estudiando porque más se inclinó por hacer negocio. Se casó a los 25 años y tiene una hija de 16 años que aún es estudiante.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de calzado y ropa, la que lleva a la sierra y la vende en los mercados de feria. También lleva calzado a Lima, vende y compra ropa para volverla a vender en Trujillo de manera ambulatoria.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en insumos para la venta de menú, en ese tiempo era su negocio.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,700 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará calzado para llevarlo a Lima.
Lola sueña con tener una gran tienda o mini mercado donde pueda abastecer de compra y venta  de toda clase de insumos.
texts.en:
Señora Lola Maqueda P. G. is 42 years of age. She belongs to the community bank "Fuente de Vida" and lives on the Chan Chan 589 El Cortijo Street, district and province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied through the fourth year of high school and did not continue studying because she was more inclined to go into business. She got married at 25 years of age and has a 16 year-old daughter who is a student. Her business is the sale of shoes and clothing, something that she brings to the mountains and sells in the markets. She also brings shoes to Lima where she sells and buys clothing to bring back to sell in Trujillo as a street vendor. With the first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in 4 payments, she invested in ingredients for the sale of a menu, in that time that was her business. With this loan of 1,700 soles ($550) that she will repay in 6 payments, she will buy shoes to bring to Lima. Lola dreams of having a grand shop or a small market stocked with every type of supply.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene 40 años de edad, es la secretaria de su Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia y vive en la calle Elías Aguirre 453 interior B, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y es costurera autodidacta, no continuó estudios superiores por falta de recursos económicos. Actualmente es separada por lo tanto madre y padre de sus hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Se dedica a la costura, confección de ropa deportiva, arreglos de vestidos, elaboración de disfraces y confección de artesanía. Todo lo realiza en el taller que se encuentra en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en su negocio comprando materiales.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará telas e hilos.
Martha sueña con poner un gran taller.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is 40 years of age, is the secretary of the "Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia" and lives on Elías Aguirre 453 interior B Street, district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed high school and is a self-taught seamstress. She did not continue in advanced studies because she lacked the economic resources. Now she is separated and therefore is the mother and father of her children who are students. She works as a dressmaker, making sports clothing, repairing dresses, making costumes, and handicrafts. She does all of this in her shop which is found in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles which she repaid in 4 payments, she invested in her business, buying materials. With this loan of 500 soles ($175) which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy fabric and threads. Martha dreams of having a grand shop.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 28 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia y vive en la calle O’Dónovan s/n, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, pero por razones de salud no continuó estudiando. Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 2 hijos que son unos niños de 8 y 6 años.
Santos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de manualidades, según la época.  El trabajo lo realiza en su casa.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelados en 4 cuotas, invirtió en productos de belleza.
Con este crédito de S/. 400 el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará material para trabajos navideños.
Santos sueña con tener una tienda donde pueda vender y exponer sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Señora Santos is 28 years of age, she belongs to the "Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia," and lives on the O’Dónovan s/n Street, district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department La Libertad, Perú. She studied through the third year of high school, but for health reasons did not continue studying. She got married at 19 years of age and has two children who are 8 and 6. Santos works in the making and sale of seasonal handicrafts. She does this work in her home. With the first loan of 300 new soles that she repaid in 4 payments, she invested in beauty products. With this loan of 400 new soles ($150) that will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy material to make Christmas decorations. Santos dreams of having a shop where she can sell and display her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials for Christmas decorations

loans.name: Sugey Yulissa

texts.es:
La señora Sugey tiene 29 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Vargas Llosa 130 El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el octavo ciclo de Ingeniería de Sistemas, pero se casó y dejó de estudiar porque tiene 2 hijos pequeños.
Su negocio consiste en el alquiler de cabinas de internet, tipéo y elaboración de trabajos de institutos, colegios y universidades, lo tiene en su casa. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, intentó incursionar en la crianza de pollos pero no resultó.
