Besides, with the increased income from the business, she will be in a position to complete her storied residential house.

loans.use: Purchasing more medicine for her shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice M. is married and has 4 children. She has attended school through the senior high school level. In 2000, Beatrice started a business selling clothing at Kissi, near the city of Elmina, Ghana. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and other family expenses. Beatrice is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of clothing to meet the demands of her customers. She plans to use the additional profits from her increased business to save towards a house for the family to live in.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing supplies to meet the demands of her costumers

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en: A. Fotima is a very hardworking and independent woman. She has three children, all of whom are in elementary school. She started a cattle business ten years ago to support her family. She has one dairy cow and sells the milk on the market. This business provides her with a good income. She wants to buy a second cow to increase the amount of milk she can sell. Milk is always in high demand because it is nutritious and affordable. Fotima is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni. She will repay the loan within 10 months. Fotima and her children are  grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Burigul

texts.en: B. Burigul has had a trying life but still maintains an optimistic outlook.  She is a widow with three children. When her husband passed away, she was left without a steady income. Supporting her large family on her own is very difficult. She nonetheless remains a strong and persevering person and is intent on improving her family’s standard of living. She dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  The income she generates provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. Burigul has a lot of experience after so many years of hard work. She is requesting a loan for 1700 Somoni ($ 500 USD) in order to buy more young cattle to raise and well.  With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Tifu

texts.en:
Thirty-eight years old and social, Tifu Mwondha is happily married with three school-age children. He sells foodstuffs & groceries like onions, tomatoes, Irish potatoes, rice, flour, garlic, green pepper, and eggplants on a retail basis in Bugiri market.

To compete favorably with his numerous competitors in the market, Tifu is using the loan to buy groceries in large quantities to meet the rising demands of his customers. Previously, Tifu was a well-known farmer who cultivated various cash crops in the area, and it is through selling his farm produce that he was able to raise some capital for his present business.

He hopes to become a prominent agricultural-based businessman some day. He desires to educate his children to the highest levels of education and strongly wants to attain financial sustainability so as to fully meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: Buying groceries like tomatoes, cucumber, garlic, onions, and avocado in large quantities

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn C., 41, is a grocery seller, whose business was started in 2000 and sells items including ingredients for cooking, and cakes for kids. Phorn lives with her three children, who are all in school. Her husband, Mr. Sopheap Nget, 46, is a motorcycle taxi driver who took on this work when he was single.

Recently, Sopheap has been feeling bored with his old motorcycle that is often broken. Hence, he discussed with his wife and decided to apply for $400 to buy a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has 5 children. She has received no formal education. Ama sells firewood which is a source of fuel for the majority of fishmongers. She also prepares a local meal called 'banku' for sale. Maize is used in the preparation of the banku which is widely eaten in the country. She sells the banku at Kissi near Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Ama uses her income to support her husband in meeting the family’s financial needs. Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more firewood to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to outfit a salon

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is 45 years of age and is married with 6 children. He is a hardworking man who operates a wholesale shop in Bugiri district. Before venturing into the wholesale business, Charles was obtaining his income from selling various food crops from his farm within the same locality. It is therefore the farming income that enabled him to set up his present business.

Charles is using the loan to add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store. Besides expanding his business, he hopes to spend some of the profits in educating his children and providing for the family’s basic needs. He enjoys farming and looks forward to opening a farm produce outlet in the area.

loans.use: To add a variety of products like cooking oil, cosmetics, toiletries, sugar, rice, wheat flour, and some snacks to his store

loans.name: Oibahor

texts.en:
B. Oibahor is 50 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman. She started her business in 1998 and she has gained skills and experience. Many people in her village seek her advice about raising livestock. 
Her primary activity is selling milk and calves. Oibahor's daughter (pictured) also helps her with the business. Oibahor would like to expand her milk production. She is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. G. is a 60-year-old widow with six children, ages 27 to 39. Her husband was attacked by thugs and unfortunately developed internal bleeding that led to his death. She lives in Kayole Corner, J area, where she operates a fabric dyeing and dress making business business.

Mary started her business in 2007 after her daughter paid for her to take a dressmaking course, before which she used to sell building stones. She started her business with money she had put together in savings from her stone business. She expanded her business to include fabric dyeing business.

Mary finds that clients often request colored scarfs and fabric that she does not have, and this causes them to take their business to her competitors. Mary is therefore requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000, which she will use to buy fabric and dyes. These additions will give her clients a variety of choices and increase her business. She will also be able to take her products to larger markets. She intends to pay back her loan in eight months.

loans.use: To purchase  fabric and dyes

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon P. is a 53-year-old who lives in the area of Loloksar Commune in Pursat Province. She is married to Mr. Eun Em, 64 years old, and they have six children, three of whom are married and have left home, and the other three attend school. They are farmers who are widely known in their area as skilled rice growers, having started in 1980.

They have not been able to do their farming as well as in previous years because they lack the necessary equipment. Phon and her husband are applying for $600 to buy a cow and a buffalo for plowing a field. (Mrs. Phon's husband is pictured, because she was not available that time).

loans.use: To buy one cow and one buffalo

loans.name: Ashurgul

texts.en:
K. Ashurgul is 49 years old. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Ashurgul has raised three children; two of her daughters are married and her son (pictured) still lives with his parents. Ashurgul has been operating a drug store for the past eight years. She sells only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of town, which ensures that she has many customers. 

Ashurgul has been IMON's client for the past three and half years.  She requests a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD). The loan will allow her to expand her business and increas her income.  She will be able to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida A. S. sells fabric and clothing at Kissi near Elmina, Ghana. Vida has received no formal education.  She is married and has 8 children. Vida has been selling fabric and clothing since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband with meeting the family's financial needs. She is requesting this loan to purchase additional supplies of clothing for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Panji

texts.en:
L. Panji is 49 years old. He is married and has six children. From a young age, Panji learned to operate a small business from his parents. Through a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer of agriculture for the area in which he lives. He continued working in the same business after he was married. With the income from the business, he was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise cattle successfully. He hopes to continue growing and improving his business and offer a better future for his children.  Panjy would like to see them develop into professional, ethical, and hardworking adults. 

He is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD). He will use the loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling animals generates an excellent profit.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and expand his business.

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.en:
L. Tukhta is 55 years old.  He lives with his wife and four children. He raises animals and the cows are the most profitable. This has been his line of work for the last 15 years and enjoys his work.  Early every morning he goes to the grazing fields to feed his stock and then takes them to the rivers and lagoons to drink water. This takes him all day. At sunset, he returns home.  He feeds and carse for his animals very well.  His children always try to help him with his work.  

Tukhta is inspired to get ahead in life because of his wife and children.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle to raise so he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for his business

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
S. Guliston is 43 years old. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She has 6 children, two of whom are already students. She would like to request a loan of 800 Somoni ($250 USD) for the term of 10 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. 
In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase the family income further. They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education. You could become an important part in the Guliston family's life; S. deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor is a hard-working person and makes an effort to give his 3 beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he feeds his animals. 
With experience gained over 3 years in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. His wife, who is pictured on the photo, helps him with the business. He would now like to purchase more cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests 1500 Somoni ($450 USD) for the term of 12 months. Mukhtor thanks you very much for your love and support.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Soimhodja

texts.en:
M. Soimhodja is 27 years old. Together with his wife they have one child. Bahodur is selling DVDs and CDs. He orders the disks from Russia and tries to have all new movies, and concerts of popular actors, singers, and others. He also provides computer services such as audio editing of video tapes and discs with records of family events of his clients. 
Soimhodja tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work so he can satisfy demands and requirements of his customers. The business is now successfully generating the main income for his family. Today Soimhodja requests $1000 US dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase more DVDs and CDs to sell. Soimhodja thanks all who are supporting him, and promises to be accurate and timely in paying the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing DVDs and CDs to sell.

loans.name: Toy

texts.en:
Mr. Toy N. is 42 years old and lives in the Ptasrong Commune in Pursat Province. He is a local farmer who grows rice and vegetables, and he has had much experience since selecting his work in 1986. His wife, Mrs. Sophal Khoun, 43, is a seller who makes a living selling groceries in her local village, with many regular customers. Sophal cares for five children, all of whom go to school.

Toy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 riel ($750) to buy piglets, a cow, and a cow-cart. The loan will allow him to improve his business and add to his fixed assets.

loans.use: To buy piglets, a cow, and a cow-cart

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Selling construction materials at the market became the only source of income for S. Bahrom, a 22-year-old young man who's been doing this for three years. This young man envisions many projects for his future; to build his own store to sell construction materials is one of them. 
He's good at what he does, this is why he's been able to support himself and his whole family through his business. His wish is to add more goods, and in that way to increase the range of goods to offer to his clients. He would pay back this loan, and with the money he would be able to pay for his technical career education. This young man waits for your help to make his dream come true.

loans.use: Purchasing of the pipe, angle bar and other construction materials

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Sané, 42 ans est mariée et a en charge 06 enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des arachides, du citron et du pain de singe (fruit du baobab). Les arachides seront transformées en pâte d’arachide puis vendu par seau de 5 kg. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour mieux assister ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama Sané is 42 years old, married and has six school-aged children. She has been a member of the Médina Plateau village bank for seven and a half years, and is in the business of buying and selling peanuts, lemons and monkey bread fruit (baobab fruit). The peanuts are processed into peanut butter, and then sold in 5-kilogram containers. Mariama wants to expand her business in order to better support her children. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid in a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lemons, monkey bread fruit, and peanuts for making peanut butter

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Курбонов Насриддин родился 19 февраля 1979 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Он живет и работает в городе Душанбе и у него любимое дело – он таксист. Иногда он работает на маршрутной линии водителем. 
Насриддин хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3500 сомони для покупки и установки газовое оборудование на свой автотранспорт.
texts.en:
Nasriddin K. was born on February 19, 1979. He is married and has two children. He lives and works in Dushanbe, and loves his taxi business. He also works as a driver for a shuttle line at times. With the help of the Kiva program, Nasriddin wants to obtain a $1050 loan in order to purchase and install gas equipment for his vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gas equipment

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Majidah is a 57-year-old widow who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with her three children. She has owned her grocery store for eleven years. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her capital. 

Majidah is unique in her line of work because she only buys good quality products, especially cleaning and shampoo products. She also sells food, candies and beverages. She decided to take the loan to diversify her merchandise. Her customers are friends, neighbors and some passers-by. She said that it is not always very easy to keep a client, which is why she is doing her best to keep them by diversifying her merchandise.
 
Majidah decided to start her business to support her family after her husband stopped working for personal reasons. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Majidah needs the loan to increase her capital

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr: Rita N., 56 ans, mariée, 04 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Médina Plateau depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce de boisson et rendre sa buvette plus rentable. Ses revenus lui permettent d’aider à améliorer l’entretien de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rita N., age 56, is married and has four children in school to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group Médina Plateau for seven and a half years. She wants a loan to boost her commerce in beverages and to make her beverages stand more profitable. Her income enables her to help take care of her family and the schooling of the children. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her drinks stand with beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of cereals and grains

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
S. Hoshim is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. His wife is a teacher and works in a public city high school, supporting her husband with the household income. For ten years now, Hoshim has been a welder. In cold seasons, he takes orders to make small stoves. Besides that, he sells the stoves at the market, where there is high demand. Now it is the beginning of the cold season and many peoples are coming to Hoshim to order a small stove. 
In Tajikistan in winter season, supplies of electricity and gas are limited, and small stoves are in great deman during that period. Now Hoshim has applied for a loan to fully meet the demand of his customers. He is asking for 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for the term of 12 months. He wants to purchase the necessary materials for making small stoves. With your help, Hoshim will be able to make his business succeed and to provide all of his children with education. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing of the necessary materials for making small stove.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is a 50-year-old carpenter, hardworking, and married with 3 children. His wife is a committed lady who owns a cattle farm in their locality. David operates Ruhaama Trust Workshop in Ntungamo on a retail basis. The success of his business is attributed to his 16 years of experience.

To meet the rising customer demands as the festive season draws near, he is using the loan to purchase timber, sofa fabrics, cushions/foam, and tools for his business. He intends to inject the profits back into the business so as to move it to a level of financial sustainability. With the continued growth of his business, David looks forward to successfully seeing his 3 children through school.

loans.use: To purchase timber, sofa fabrics, cushions/foam, and tools for his business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is married and the mother of 4 children. She is uneducated and works in tailoring. She has been involved in this business for more than 5 years but has not been able to expand her business. Now she plans to enlarge her business and rent a shop so she completed all the documents and applied for a loan.

She requested an individual loan of 40000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to complete her stock and start working hard to attract a good number of clients and make good monthly income for her family to support them better. It is one of her fond wishes and she is sure that she can do it. She really appreciates this loan process in Afghanistan.

She is happy and would like to thank everyone who helped this loan process in this poor country. She plans to continue her partnership and, day by day, improve her business. She would like to thank Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: To complete her stock and rent a shop

loans.name: Daouda Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda Adama C. est un célibataire de 28 ans qui vit avec son enfant, son père, sa mère, ses frères et soeurs  dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Afin de s’insérrer dans la vie économique, le jeune diplômé Daouda opte pour l’achat et la vente de tissus une activité apprise auprès de son frère. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, il maitrise bien cette activité. En manque de moyens financiers conséquents, il décida de faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter,  8 rouleaux  de tissus et 20 draps de lit  sur commande à partir du  Burkina Faso. Les tissus sont découpés en petits lots pouvant etre utilisé pour confectionner des complets (Chemise et Pantalon) ou des pantalons simples. Réputé pour vendre des tissus de qualité, la clientèle de Monsieur C. ne cesse d’augmenter. La vente se fait à domicile, au niveau des entreprises en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement à une clientèle  composée de toutes les catégories socilaes. Il envisage d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus de vente de toutes qualités à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Adama C. is a single 28-year-old man who lives with his child, his father, his mother, and his brothers and sisters in a traditional family in the Torakabougou area of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). In order to join the working world, the young, educated Daouda has chosen to buy and sell fabric, a business he learned from his brother. With 10 years of experience, he is mastering the trade. Lacking consistent financial means, he decided to seek the aid of microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. He plans to use this loan to buy 8 bolts of fabric and 20 custom bed sheets in Burkina Faso. The material is cut into small pieces that can be used to make suits (shirts and pants) or ordinary pants. With a reputation for selling quality fabrics, Mr. C.’s clientele hasn’t stopped growing. He sells from his house at retail for cash or credit payable monthly to a clientele that consists of all social groups. He envisions opening a fabric shop in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Allen M. is a determined business lady who owns a clothes shop in Kabwohe Training Center. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Allen is happily married with 2 children, and her spouse is an accountant with Bushenyi town council.

She is using the loan to increase the stock of clothes in the shop. She is so excited for the financial support and hopes to have a sustainable business. Allen not only depends on her clothes shop for income but also owns a cattle farm and sells milk in the area. She dreams of expanding her farm, thereby increasing its output.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes for her business

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah T. is a courageous business lady aged 39. She runs a retail shop in Mbarara Taxi Park that sells mainly clothes and groceries. She is married with 4 children and has basically been running her business for a period of 10 years.

Dorah is using the loan to purchase clothes for her shop because she expects increased sales, especially during the festive season. As her business grows and profits increase, her ambitions are to see her children through all levels of education successfully.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her shop

loans.name: Iborat

texts.en:
Y. Iborat is 37 years old. She lives with her spouse, and works every day starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her 2 children successfully finish school and enter University. Iborat sells clothes and toys for kids. Her business is located near her house. 
Thanks to the support of her spouse and her own efforts, she was able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space and now has a bigger space and a large clientele. With the loan of 1400 Somoni ($425 USD), which she will repay in 12 months, she will buy a greater variety of clothing and toys. You can be an important part of the growth of Iborat’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of clothes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is a 31-year-old widow. She is a promising business lady who owns a wholesale/retail shop in Mbarara Taxi Park. Besides her business, she works as an accountant for the Mbarara Taxi Drivers Association. She is a loving mother of 1 and a law-abiding citizen.

To compete favorably in the market and meet the increasing demand of customers, Harriet is using the loan to add a variety of commodities to her shop. She expects more profits during the festive season, which she will re-invest in the business. The income from this business also enables her to look after her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of commodities for her shop

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame Kadia T. est une  veuve de 54 ans qui vit avec ses 4 enfants dans la consession de son feu  mari situé dans le quartier Niebala de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle décide de faire le commerce de bazins (tissus très prisé en afrique de l’ouest). Il achetera avec ce prêt, 15 piéces de bazins blancs auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Ensuite elle signe un contrat de prestation avec des teinturières de Bougouni pour teindre les tissus en différentes colories et motifs prisés ou demandés par la clientèle..
Elle effectue ses ventes d’une façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. Par ailleurs elle effectue des ventes dans les prefectures voisines de Bougouni notamment Kolondieba et Yanfolila.
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000FCFA  qui sera utlisé essentiellement pour renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia T. is a 54-year old widow who lives with her 4 children in the home of her deceased husband, located in the Niebala neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Since she didn't get the chance to attend school for social reasons, she started to work and make money early on. She decided to sell "bazin" cloth (highly prized cloth in Western Africa). With this loan, she will buy 15 pieces of withe "bazin" from merchants in the grand market of Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She then contracts dyers in Bougouni to tint the fabrics in various prized colors or patterns, as requested by her clientele. She then sells the fabrics door-to-door in various neighborhoods in the city, to a mostly female clientele. Furthermore, she also sells in the neighboring cities, most notably in Kolondieba and Yonfolila. With this loan, she foresees to make a profit of XOF 30'000 (ca 60 US$), to be mainly used to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de bazins

loans.name: Begum Khursheed M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Begum Khursheed baji is a wife of M.. She resides in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. She is the mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her daughters are in primary school. Her son has a bread making business.

Begum baji’s husband is a mason. She has a business sewing clothes, which she has been running for the past eight years. She charges $2 per suit that she sews. She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy flour for her son so that he can make more bread to sell in his business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Naikan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khursheedan baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy supplies such as cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty parlor. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy materials such as cooking oil and spices for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy flour for bread making

loans.name: Muniran M.ameen Group

texts.en:
Muniran baji is a wife of M.. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a salesman who sells furniture. Her younger son has a henna selling business. Her daughter is in the 7th standard grade. Muniran baji’s husband is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Muniran baji makes embroidered dresses and charges $3 to $4 per embroidered dress. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wooden furniture (chairs and tables) for her elder son's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bakhtawar baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kosar baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy furniture to resell

loans.name: Rashida Parveen Sakhe Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Rashida parveen baji is 20 years old and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan. Her husband, S. M., is a wood seller. Rashida baji has no children. She completed her education through 8th standard. She couldn’t complete her education because her parents arranged her marriage with S. M.. Rashida baji is a very talented lady who learned the art of knitting clothes from her mother. Now she knits clothes and helps her husband in improving the financial situation of her household. She is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Shahnaz baji requests a loan to buy a grinding machine in which she will grind flour and wheat to sell in markets. Shamim akhtar baji and Farida baji each request a loan to buy thread to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for wood-selling business

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kaniz Fatima baji is 36 years old and a wife of M. A. who owns a video game shop. Children come to his shop to play video games. Kaniz baji has six children: three sons and three daughters. Her elder son runs a canteen where he sells home cooked food (chick peas and rice dish). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Kaniz baji prepares food for her son’s canteen on daily basis. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another video game for her husband’s shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji requests a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Bashiran baji requests a loan to buy bangles to resell. Mumtaz baji and Lal baji each request a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy stock for a video game shop

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S., 29 ans, mariée, 02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Houlata depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissu teinté, de wax, chaussures dames, mèches et greffage. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata S., age 29, is married, has two children in her care, and has been a member of the village loan group Sinthiang Houlata for two years. She wants to bolster her commerce in dyed cloth, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), women's shoes, and hair extensions (mèches and greffage). Her income allows her to help cover family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth, shoes, and hair extensions

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Haytham has a pickup truck that he uses to move furniture and clothes from one place to another. He has requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua to improve his business by repairing his tires and upgrading his pickup truck. 

Haytham has been a microcredit client for 12 years and has always repaid his loans on schedule.  

Haytham says that he is unique because he has good prices, takes good care of the furniture that he moves, and ensures good transportation. Usually, his clients are special furniture shops or private movers

When he first started his business, he faced some difficulties in buying his truck, because he used to work as a mover and had a very modest income. Now that he works independently, he plans to improve his business. In the future, he wants to buy another pickup truck and rent it so he can earn money from it.

loans.use: Haytham needs the loan to repair his tires and upgrade his pickup truck

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a 40-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Jaber is a fisherman, but it is not his only work. He also trades used furniture. He has been a fisherman for more than 15 years. Fishing has been his hobby since he was a child. With time, his hobby became his business, but now he wants to start a new business selling used furniture. 

Jaber has asked for a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua to start his new business. His will use the loan for trading used furniture. This is the first time that he requested a loan. 

Jaber works all year long. He fishes all the time, whether the weather is cold or not. He usually uses a cage, a fishing cane, and a net. His customers are traders at Saida’s port.

When he first started his business, Jaber didn’t have enough funds to purchase material, which made him accumulate debt. Indeed, he needs the loan in order to help him start his new business selling used furniture.

loans.use: Jaber needs the loan to start his new business: selling used furniture

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 36 year old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with his wife. Bilal is a taxi driver. He likes taking care of his car by cleaning it very often and doing maintenance on it. Therefore, Bilal requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do more maintenance on his car. This is the first time that Bilal has asked for a loan. Bilal isn’t a regular taxi driver: he has passengers, but he also transports employees and students as well.

In the beginning of his working life, he faced some difficulties because he had to borrow money in order to buy taxi plates. He used to be a driver before, but then he preferred starting his own business by being a taxi driver. In the future, he plans to buy a bus to transport employees and students.

loans.use: Bilal needs the loan to do maintenance on his car

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 46-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mahmoud has been working as a blacksmith. He does doors and windows. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase some steel.

Mahmoud is known for his good work because he does nice handicrafts. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He started his business after returning from abroad. He had no family support so he had to find a way to make a living. Therefore, he had the idea to start his own business. But in the beginning, it was hard for him because he had to learn the business. He plans in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: Mahmoud needs the loan to purchase steel

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is a photographer. She has her own photography studio. Fumilayo takes pictures at weddings, funerals, birthdays, and other ceremonies. She needs a loan of 140,000 naira ($1200) to purchase a digital computer printer and a generator. Her customers are asking for faster photo processing times, and she wants to meet this demand. Fumilayo is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To buy a digital computer printer and generator

loans.name: Elsa Carmen

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Union II Village Bank. She is married and has three children. 

Elsa’s husband fixes computers in Huanta, the district that neighbors Ayacucho. He works from home, and his work is well known, since there are few computer repair services in the area. Elsa is requesting a loan of 2500 soles to buy replacement parts for computers. 

Elsa has been working with FINCA for 13 years and is one of the institution’s best clients. She says that FINCA has been a great help in both her business and personal life, and has allowed her and her family to get ahead. She was able to build a three-story house thanks to FINCA, which she now earns rental income from. She also bought four freezers to make ice, which she sells from her home, and a computer for her son, who is going to college in Lima. 

Elsa’s dream for the future is to buy an apartment in Lima to be closer to her son.

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for computers

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.fr: Née vers les années 1963 à Dogbo dans le département du Couffo, dame F. Sogbossi est mariée à TOSSOU Codjo soudeur de profession. Mère de 04 enfants dont 03 sont scolarisés et un en apprentissage. Elle exerce la vente des céréales depuis 20 ans et aide son mari par les revenus générés par la vente. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite auprès de notre institution un crédit de 180000.
texts.en:
Born around 1963 in Dogbo, in Couffo County, Ms. Sogbossi F. est married to Codjo TOSSOU, a welder by trade. She is a mother with four children, of whom three are in school and one is in an apprenticeship. She has been selling grain for twenty years and assists her husband by the income from her sales. To bolster her business, she is requesting from our institution a loan of 180,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by sacks of staple foods and some containers of palm wine

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Union II Village Bank. She is 50 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are independent, working professionals. She still supports her two younger children, who are currently getting their college degrees. 

Adelaida owns a bakery in the San Sebastian neighborhood of the city of Ayacucho. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more flour and other materials to make chapla (a traditional local bread) and to pay for some personal expenses for her children. She is a long-time client of FINCA Peru, and says that the organization has helped her get out of a lot of tough situations over the nine years she has been working with them. This will be Adelaida’s second Kiva loan. 

Adelaida dreams of being able to take some time off of work to rest and take a little vacation with her husband.

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Celso Jesus

texts.es: Don Celso habita en un barrio que se llama Concepción de Maria en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, estudiante de la primaria en la escuelita del barrio, el señor Celso trabaja de conductor desde hace muchos años, pues se le ha hecho difícil cambiar de trabajo lo cual desearía para mejorar sus ingresos y a si poder terminar de construir su casa que es de madera lo cual quiere hacerla de concreto para tener una vivienda digna para su familia. Con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en comprar  materiales de construcción ya que va a construir paredes de su casa. A largo plazo es poder seguir haciendo mejoras  a la vivienda ya que es su anhelo.
texts.en:
Mr. Celso P. lives in a neighborhood called Concepción de Maria, in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have two children, ages 8 and 12, who attend the neighborhood school. Mr. P. has been working as a driver for many years because it has been difficult for him to change occupations, which he would like to do in order to earn more income. He would like to finish building his wooden house and make it out of concrete so that he can have a decent home for his family. He wants to invest this loan in purchasing construction materials as he is going to build the walls of his house. In the long run, he would like to be able to continue with home improvement—his greatest wish.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build two walls

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mrs Mama Tye is married and has six childen who are currently in school, She is 36 years old and lives in the town of Koforidua, Ghana. Mama sells food such as cassava dough, corn dough and maize in the local market. Cassava and corn dough are produced by milling fresh cassava and maize to obtain the main ingredient for banku, a popular Ghanaian food dish. She has been selling food products for the past 8 years and has built up a large clientele. 

Mama T. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with a quality education for their future careers. She is requesting this loan to purchase an additional stock of cassava and maize to produce both cassava and corn dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of a borrowing group called the Mawu Ngoo (meaning God is good) Trust Group. In this group members provide support to one another in managing repayment. She does not sell on the days of her group meetings and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for this loan assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 49 años de edad es cadete de un taxi de las cinco de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde ya que trabajan  por turnos, pero también se dedica en sus horas libres a la venta de carne de res, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana Grande, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,12 y 16 años de edad, los tres están estudiando, y se los cuida su mama ya que ella trabaja en un almacén para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia ya que tienen que recoger el abono de Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficios para lograr sus objetivos pues con esta solicitud es la tercera y la quiere para hacer un sumidero  en su casa, y  así estar mas higiénico.
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old and he is a taxi driver, working a shift from 5a.m. until 2pm. In his spare time he sells beef meat. He lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Sabana Grande. His wife has given him three children of 6, 12, and 16 years of age. All three are attending school and he takes care of them while she's away at work in a warehouse. She works so that she can help her husband with the family expenses. Loans they have acquired from Afodenic have given them a way to meet their objectives. This is their third request for a loan and the funds are destined install a bathroom in their home, to create a more hygenic environment.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: Don Norlan tiene 22 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación,  su esposa le tiene un hijo de 3 meses,  que se lo cuida su mama ya que ella labora en zona franca,  como operaria esto con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo para poder ahorrar y comprar un terreno para hacer nuestra propia casa ya que habitamos con mis padres. El Sr. Norlan vende  productos lácteos desde hace un año, que comenzó con liquidación de su trabajo anterior que era en zona franca y laboraba en los turnos de noche, pues con esta solicitud desea invertir en materia prima en la compra de crema y así `poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, lo cual desea que estén sastifechos con el servicio que el les da ya que desea captar muchos clientes y poder beneficiarse mucho. A largo plazo es poder tener un puesto de venta de queso en su casa, y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Norlan is 22 years old. He lives in Villa Reconciliación; he and his wife have a 3-month-old son who is in the care of his grandmother since Norlan's wife works in a factory in the free-trade zone. They are saving to buy a plot of land on which to build a house, since they are currently living with Norlan's parents. Norlan has been selling dairy products for a year. He started when he was laid off from his old job in the free-trade zone, where he worked nights. He wants the loan to purchase raw materials: to buy cream so as to be able to meet his customers' demand. He wants them to be happy with the service he provides and to obtain many more customers and prosper. His long-term ambition is to build his own house and have a cheese shop there.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy products

loans.name: Margoth

texts.en: Margot is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Margot is 29 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She studies computer programming and currently works in a company that sews and prints logos on athletic clothing, where she works from 8am to 7pm. She also sells prepaid phone cards in her mother’s store, and she plans to open a call center.  Margot needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy everything she needs to open her call center.  Margot dreams of having her own investment capital to open her own sewing and logo-printing business.

loans.use: Open a call center

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a su esposo con las necesidades del hogar ya que querían  darles a sus 3 hijos Brenda Berenice de 19 años, estudiante de la carrera de Psicología; Sergio Iván de 12 años estudiante de primaria y Karla Gissele de 11 años, estudiante de primaria, una carrera universitaria. Comenzó en el mes de Enero de 1996 cuando una amiga la  invitó a su casa a una demostración de perfumes, que fue lo primero que empezó a vender, después ella seguí por su cuenta y como le empezó a ir bien en el año 2000 empezó a vender también cosméticos de reconocidas marcas y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien y le queda una ganancia suficiente para ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios. 

Ella necesita un préstamo por 10,000 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar más productos que le ayuden a tener un inventario mas variado para poder surtir a sus clientes y seguir dándoles una buena atención.
texts.en:
Angelina started her business to obtain an extra income and help her husband with the household necessities, especially because they wanted to provide their 3 children with an education: Brenda Berenice is 19 years old and she is completing a degree in Psychology; Sergio Ivan is 12 years old and he attending primary school; and Karla Gissele is 11 years old and she is also attending primary school. She started in January 1996 when a friend invited her to her home to showcase some perfumes, which was the first things she sold. Later one she went out on her own and found success. In the year 2000 she started also selling cosmetics of well known brands and this has also gone very well. This has given her enough earnings to help her husband and their children with their studies.

She requires a loan amounting to 10,000, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase more products to increase the selection in her inventory, and be able to supply her clientele with good customer service.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Margarita Concepción

texts.es:
Margarita es una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta y optimista. Ella inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y porque le gustan mucho las ventas y como sus hijos ya están grandes y pueden valerse solos y le quedaba mas tiempo libre. Comenzó en el mes de Febrero de 2006, en el patio de su casa vendiendo la ropa que dejábamos en la familia y después una de sus vecinas la animó para que comprara pacas de ropa usada las cuales salen muy baratas y se vende rápido y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por $5,000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y tener un buen surtido para esta época de fin de año que se acerca y que es cuando la gente comprar mas ropa.
texts.en:
Margarita is hard-working, enthusiastic and optimistic. She went into business because she wanted to feel useful and because she likes working in sales; since her children were grown and can look after themselves, she had more free time. She started in February 2006 in the patio of her house, selling her own family's used clothing. Encouraged by her neighbours, she bought bales of used clothes, which are very cheap and sell quickly. She has been very successful since then. She needs a loan of $5,000, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy a bale of clothes and have a good range of merchandise for the year-end season, when people tend to buy more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bale of clothes

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha es  una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, responsable cumplida y a la que no le gusta darse por vencida.
Ella inició el negocio por el compromiso que tiene de sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos: Armando de 19 años estudiante universitario; Uriel de 14 años estudiante de secundaria; Luís de 7 años estudiante de primaria y Marlen de 5 años estudiante de pre-primaria, dándoles una buena educación y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que con su sueldo a veces no es suficiente.
 Comenzó en Octubre de 2001 vendiendo solamente refrescos y dulces, después empezó a vender botanas y pan de reconocidas marcas, y como le estaba yendo bien acondiciono un local en la parte de enfrente de su casa en donde pudo poner una tiendita mas surtida y desde entonces gracias le ha ido muy bien. Además, hace algunos meses, también empezó  a elaborar y a vender tamales los fines de semana.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 7,000 MXN que pagara en 6  meses para comprar mercancia y resurtir su tienda y tener mejores y más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is an honest, responsible, reliable, hard-working woman who doesn't give up easily. She went into business in order to help raise her four children: Armando (19) is at university; Uriel (14) is attending secondary school; Luis (7) is in primary school; Marlen (5) is in pre-school. Martha's goal is to give them a good education and help her husband with the household expenses since his salary often isn't enough. She started up in October 2001, selling just soft drinks and sweets. Later she started selling sandwiches and brand-name bread. Since she was doing well, she set up a store in the front of her house where she sells a broad range of products. She has been very successful since then. Some months ago, she started making tamales on weekends. She needs a loan of 7,000 MXN, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and re-stock her store, so as to have more and better products to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Reyna Adelina

texts.es: Doña Reyna tiene 51 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Augusto Cesar Sandino, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 12,18 y 20 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian y el mayor esta trabajando para ayudar a los gastos de la familia, la Sra. Reyna vende carne de cerdo, nacatamales, chicharrón y todo lo derivado con los platillos de carne de cerdo, lleva veinte años de estar en las ventas que inicio con prestamos en una financiera, lo cual fue de beneficios para su inicio, ahora hago préstamo en Afodenic pues me ha dado la oportunidad y facilidad de pago pues sus intereses son bajos este es la séptima solicitud lo cual quiero para invertir en ropa, zapatos, ya que las ventas son buenas en esta fechas de la época de Navidad, a largo plazo desea seguir manteniendo su negocio, hacer mejoras a su casa y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan gozar de una vida mas moderada.
texts.en:
Doña Reyna is fifty one years old, and lives in a neighborhood of the capital of Nicaragua called Augusto Cesar Sandino. She and her spouse have three children who are 12, 18, and 20 years old. Two of her children study and the oldest is working to help pay for the family's expenses. Señora Reyna sells pork meat, tamales, cracklings, and every other pork product. She has twenty years of experience being in sales, which began with loans from a financier covering her business' startup costs. Now she is asking to borrow a loan from Afodeni, which will provide her an opportunity, and the credit terms are that her interest is low. This is her seventh request, which she wants in order to invest in clothes and shoes, which sell very well during this period before Christmas. In the long-term, this loan would allow her to continue the maintenance of her business, make improvements to her house, support her children who are in school and allow her family to enjoy a more moderate lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar ropa de niño y adulto

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan Gabriel es una persona  trabajadora, cumplida, responsable y con ganas de salir adelante.
El inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra ya que con lo que gana como repartidor de una conocida marca de refrescos no le alcanzaba para solventar los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus 2 hijas  Melanni de 13 años estudiante de secundaria y Viridiana de 10 años estudiante de primaria, como le gustan las ventas decidió empezar vendiendo refrescos  ya que por su casa no hay cerca ningún negocio de este tipo, quiso ser el primero en iniciarlo y poco a poco ir incorporando otros artículos para tener una tiendita bien surtida. Comenzó hace más de  un año con este proyecto y gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido redituando con buenas ganancias.  

El necesita un préstamo por 7,000MXN que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así resurtir su tiendita y poder ofrecer productos más variados para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Gabriel is a hard-working, accomplished, responsible person who wants to get ahead in life. He started his business because he needed to obtain extra income as what he earnt as the delivery man for a well-known brand of soft drinks didn't cover his household expenses and the education of his two daughters, Melanni aged 13 and a secondary-school student and Viridiana aged 10 and at primary school. As he likes sales, he decided to beign selling soft drinks from his house as there was no similar business located nearby and he wanted to be the first to begin one. Little by little he included other products so his little shop is now well-stocked. He needs a loan of 7000 MXN which he will repay in six months in order to buy merchandise and restock his shop and to be able to offer more varied products to his customers. With your help he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cesar Gerardo

texts.es: EL SEÑOR C. ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE DENTRO Y FUERA DE SU TRABAJO, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA ABIGAIL TIENE SU TIENDITA Y DE ESTA MANERA SE APOYAN MUTUAMENTE COMO UNA FAMILIA UNIDA, ELLOS POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITAN REALIZARAN EL PROYECTO DE CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO EN LA PARTE DE ENFRENTE DE SU CASITA Y ASI TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA ELLOS Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Whether it is a matter of work or family, Mr. C. is a very responsible person. His wife, Abigail, has a small store, and together they support their family as a team. With this loan, they will build a room in the front of their house for themselves and for the increased comfort of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build another room in their house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela Fortunata

texts.en: Graciela is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Graciela is 52 years old and married with four children. She travels to regional fairs three times per week to sell dry goods and clothing. At the fairs, she buys grains, animals, cheese and eggs to resell in the Nery Garcia Market.  Graciela needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy skirts, sweaters and blouses.  Graciela’s dreams are to buy a stand in one of Ayacucho’s markets and for her children to finish school.

loans.use: Buy skirts, sweaters and blouses

loans.name: Marissa Alejandra

texts.es:
Marissa es una mujer  honesta, sincera y muy trabajadora.  Como muchas mujeres ha tenido que ser  madre y padre a la vez de sus  2 hijos: Manuel Alejandro de 12 años, estudiante de secundaria y Antonia Margarita de 5 años que asiste a pre-escolar.
Ella inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra, ya que aunque tiene un trabajo como soldadora en una empresa privada, el sueldo no le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Comenzó en el mes de Enero de 2006, pero antes tuvo que irse a trabajar a los Estados Unidos un año para poder juntar dinero y después iniciar su negocio. Cuando regreso de allá se trajo unas pacas de ropa usada y le fue muy bien, y ahora se las mandan de allá o cuando tiene vacaciones o descansos aprovecha para ir a comprarlas personalmente.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 5,000 MXN que pagara en 4 meses para comprar una paca de ropa y poder ofrecerle más variedad de ropa a sus clientes en esta época de fin de año que se acerca.
texts.en:
Marissa is honest, sincere and hard-working. Like many women, she is raising her 2 children on her own. Manuel Alejandro (12) is in secondary school, and Antonia Margarita (5) is in pre-school.She started the business to supplement her income. Although she works as a welder in a company, her wages are not enough to cover her needs and those of her children.

After working in the United States for a year to earn money with which to go into business, she started up in January 2006. When she returned from the US, she brought some bales of used clothing and sold them succesfully. Now she gets used clothes shipped from the US or she travels there herself during vacations and holidays to buy merchandise in person.

She needs a loan of 5,000 MXN, which she wll repay in four months, to buy a bale of clothes and offer more variety to her customers during the forthcoming season.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bale of clothes

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Juana is 48 years old and married with three children. Juana has a store in her home on a busy street where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meats, drinks and ice cream with the help of her daughter.  Juana needs a loan of 2500 soles to buy phone cards, soap and milk.  Juana dreams of buying a pay phone for her business, offering a wider variety of products, and for her children to finish school.

loans.use: Buy different flavors of ice cream

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es: Don Jorge es separado de su esposa hace muchos años, el se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el último esta todavia vivendo con él pero ya es independiente economicamente, su hijo tiene aproximadamente 22 años. Trabaja con taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. También es conocido por algunas empresas de courrier las cuales contratan sus servicios para entrega de paquetes y sobres. La competencio es de media a baja, existe demanda para su servicio. El credito fue para realizar refacciones en su vehículo en general. Es un cliente antiguo de la institucion, sus promedios estan entre 3 dias de retaso aproximadamente pero es un cliente que es fiel a la institución y que solo trabaja con nosotros.
texts.en:
Don Jorge has been separated from his wife for many years, and he has taken care of their children. The youngest still lives with him but is economically independent. His son is 22. Jorge has worked as a taxi driver for many years, so he has a lot of experience. He is known by courier companies, which hire him to deliver packages and envelopes. His competition ranges from medium to low; there is a demand for his services. This credit will go towards making general repairs to his vehicle. He is an old client of our institution. His payments on average are 3 days late, but he is a loyal client of ours and only works with us.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin es separado, tiene 57 años y vive solo. Desde hace mas de 8 años fabrica todo tipo de artículos en cuerina y cuero, elabora carteras, monederos, billeteras, entre otros artículos, con una máquina de coser cuero, la cual es un instrumento indispensable para su trabajo. Esta es su ocupación diaria y sus lugares de venta son principalmente los mercados de las ciudades de Huancayo y Huancavelica, cubre pedidos de sus clientes que solicitan de acuerdo a las temporadas los artículos que más demanda tienen. Para Edwin, un reto a superar es la creciente  competencia, sabe que tiene que innovar con nuevos diseños, por ejemplo en las carteras. Este es su primer ciclo con MFP, sin embargo él ya tiene un historial crediticio  con buenas referencias. Don Edwin solicita este préstamo que le servirá para aumentar su  capital de trabajo, comprar más cuero al por mayor, ya que éste es su insumo básico.
texts.en:
Edwin is 57-year-old man who is separated and lives alone. For over 8 years, he has been making all types of leather and faux leather goods—such as wallets, coin purses, and handbags, among other items—with a sewing machine for leather, which is an indispensable work tool. This is his occupation, and he sells his products mainly in the markets of Huancayo and Huancavelica. He fills his customers’ orders depending the highest demands of the season. For Edwin, a challenge that he needs to overcome is ever-increasing competition. He knows that he must innovate with new designs for the handbags. This is his first cycle with MFP; however, he already has a credit history with good references. Mr. Edwin S. is requesting this loan in order to increase his work capital—he wants to purchase more wholesale leather because he uses this material the most.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more leather to make leather goods

loans.name: Aydalina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aydalina habita en un bario de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene 37 años de edad, con dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad el mayor esta en la primaria en el escuelita del barrio, su esposo trabaja de cadete en un taxi, la Sra. Aydalina tiene una pulpería desde hace cuatro años, que inicio con fondos de ahorro que su esposo le dio, tuvo la iniciativa de trabajar con prestamos en Afodenic para elevar las ventas con inventario nuevo, esta es la cuarta solicitud lo cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, y adornos navideños ya que la época es buena y espera tener un crecimiento en inventario como captar nuevos clientes, a largo plazo es poder vender otros productos que sastifagan a las necesidades del cliente.
texts.en:
Aydalina lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Laureles Sur. She is 37 years old and she has 2 children, 2 and 7 years of age. The eldest is attending primary school in the region. Her husband is a taxi driver. Aydalina has had her convenience store for the past 4 years. She started out with savings her husband gave her and from loans acquired by Afodenic. The loans have helped her acquire new inventory, this being the fourth loan she has requested. The funds will be used to invest in the purchase of clothing and Christmas decorations. This is a good season for sales and she hopes to attract new clients with more inventory. In the long term she would like to sell other products to satisfy the demands of her clientele.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: DON WILSON ES SEPARADO DE SU PRIMERA ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE UNA HIJA, PASA PENSIONES PARA MANUTENCION. ACTUALMENTE VIVE SOLO JUNTO CON SUS PADRES QUE SON PERSONAS MAYORES, PERO DESEA FORMALIZAR CON SU SEGUNDA PAREJA, NO VIVEN JUNTOS PERO YA TUVIERON UN BEBE. TRABAJA EN LA POLICIA HACE 17 AÑOS. ES ASALARIADO POR LO CUAL NO TIENE COMPETENCIA. EL DESTINO ES PARA COMPRAR UNA COCINA INDUSTRIAL, GARRAFA Y UTENCILIOS DE COCINA. ES UN CLIENTE QUE EN LA INSTITUCION TIENE BUEN CUMPLIMIENTO CON UN PROMEDIO DE CERO DIAS DE RETRASO.
texts.en:
Don Wilson is separated from his first wife, with whom he had a daughter. He pays his first wife child support. Now he lives alone with his elderly parents, but he wants to marry again. He and his second partner don't live together, but they already have a baby together. He has worked in the police force for seventeen years. He has a salary, but it is insufficient. He will allocate the loan to buy an industrial kitchen, a carafe, and kitchen utensils. He is a client that has good compliance with an average of zero late repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a kitchen and utensils

loans.name: Elisa Dorcas

texts.en: Elisa is a member of the Union II Village Bank. She is 32 years old and has four children, who she lives with in a rental home. Elisa sells D’Onofrio ice cream from a mobile ice cream cart near the Santa Clara Market. She works every day, with the help of her children.  Elisa needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy different flavors of ice cream.  Elisa’s dream is to own a plot of land to build a house of her own on and to have a stable business.

loans.use: Buy different flavors of ice cream

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos. Desde su juventud, le ayudó a su madre a atender los negocios familiares, en la actualidad la vemos  dedicada a su propio restaurante, donde recibe a sus clientes de manera muy amable, sus 15 años de experiencia avalan el buen desempeño de su restaurante. Hace un mes decidió abrir su negocio en un mejor local, ofreciendo comida de muy buena calidad, en el poco tiempo que está en este local ha adquirido rápidamente clientes, esto le da más aliento a Mercedes, para seguir trabajando en su propia fuente de ingresos económicos. Este es su primer préstamo accedido en MFP. Solicita este dinero que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su restaurante, como sacos enteros de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 41 years old and lives with her two children. Ever since childhood, she has helped her mother handle the family businesses. She currently runs her own restaurant, where she kindly welcomes her patrons. Her 15 years of experience guarantee that her restaurant will do well. One month ago, she decided to open her restaurant in a better business space, where she makes high-quality meals. In what little time she has been there, she has quickly acquired customers, which really encouraged Mercedes to keep working on her sole source of income. This is her first loan with MFP. She is requesting this loan to invest it in purchasing provisions—such as sacks of rice, sugar, and legumes—for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase restaurant provisions

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía tiene 40 años y vive con su madre. Desde hace más de 3 años que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, comenzó con poca mercadería, pero poco a poco ha ido aumentando, a tal punto que puede llevar a vender a la ciudad de Lima, su trabajo consiste en adquirir los productos lácteos al por mayor, luego venderlos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son comerciantes que tiene sus puestos en un mercado cercano a su casa, de esa manera, Sofía mantiene su casa, con mucho esmero y dedicación. Para ella lo más difícil fue cuando no tenía capital, pero ahora está creciendo poco a poco, y con varios con proyectos de mejorar en su mente. Ella es cliente nueva en MFP, pero ha participado anteriormente en los préstamos, y sabe la dinámica de trabajo, promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Sofía solicita el monto de 1000 soles, con el que podrá  acrecentar su capital de trabajo e implementar el  negocio que tiene en mente, que es la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Sofía is 40 years old and lives with her mother. For over 3 years, she has been selling dairy products for a living. She started out with only a small amount of merchandise, but it has been increasing little by little, so much so that she is now able to sell her products in the city of Lima. Her job consists of obtaining wholesale dairy products, then selling them to her customers, who are mostly vendors who have stands in the market near her home. Much like she runs her business, Sofía maintains her household with great care and dedication. For her, the most difficult stage was when she did not have any capital, but now her business is gradually increasing, and she has several plans in mind. She is a new member of MFP, but she has previously been involved with loans and she knows about work dynamics. She promises to make her payments punctually. Sofía is currently requesting a 1,000.00 PEN loan with which she will be able to increase her work capital and establish a food sale business that she has in mind.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish new food sale business

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en: Marleny is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Marleny is 37 years old and married with one daughter. Marleny sells two different lines of cosmetics by catalogue. She sells on credit to her clients, most of whom are friends, family members, and work associates.  Marleny needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy creams and perfumes.  Marleny’s dreams are to build her own house, provide her children with a good future, and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy creams and perfumes

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SINDY TIENE SU TIENDITA EN SU CASA ELLA TENIA UN SUEÑO TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO Y LO HA LOGRADO POR SU GRAN ESFUERZO Y RESPONSABILIDAD, AHORA ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCANCIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDITA  ASI ELEVAR LAS VENTAS Y CRECER ECONOMICAMENTE.
texts.en:
Señora Sindy has a small shop in her house. She dreams of having her own business, and she has managed with a great deal of effort and responsibility. Now she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise to supply her small store so she can raise her sales and grow economically.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maximiliana Natalia

texts.en: Natialia is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Natalia is 58 years old and married with four children. Natalia has a restaurant/bar in a rented space located on the main plaza of the city of Ayacucho. Natalia sells drinks during the week and sometimes prepares food for special events and family functions. She and her husband also decorate for parties.  Natalia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy beer and soda.  Natalia dreams that her children will be successful, have businesses, and be excellent working professionals.

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Doris tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos de 13,18 y 28 años de edad, que estudian, el mayor trabaja y es independiente, doña Doris vende comida en una zona franca es ambulante pero ya tiene sus clientela les vende al cantado y al crédito pues su mayor dificultad es no tener un local fijo, ella inicio con dinero que presto en una financiera,  ya son diez años de estar en las ventas, actualmente trabaja con prestamos que Afodenic le otorga a bajas tasas de interés para mantener su negocio surtido y con variedad de platillos para ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicios. A largo plazo es obtener un kiosco en la zona franca para vender mas y crecer en ventas como en captar mas clientes, ayudar a sus dos hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris P. is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 13, 18, and 28, who study. The eldest works and is independent. Ms. P. sells food in a free trade zone. Even though she is a street vendor, she already has an established clientele. She sells food for cash and credit, but her biggest problem is not having a fixed business space. She started the business with money that she obtained from a bank. She has been in sales for 10 years now. She currently works with loans that Afodenic gives her at low interest rates in order to keep her business well-stocked with a variety of dishes to offer great customer service. In the long run, she hopes to have her own kiosk in the free trade zone in order to boost sales and reach out to more customers. She wants to help her two children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains and vegetables for food preparation

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan N. is 35 years old. He is married with two children.  He has been a photographer for the past ten years. He also does glass cutting and video shooting. Jonathan owns a photography and video shop where his clients can pose for their photographs. He attends occasions such as parties and concerts to photograph his clients. He is requesting this  loan to enable him to buy additional tools and materials such as camera, flash, video camera, and glass to expand his business. He belongs to the community group called Living Faith Trust Group. In this group, the members provide a guarantee for one another, social collateral to access loans and peer pressure, to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials such as camera, flash, video camera, glass etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: LA SEÑORA GUADALUPE ES UNA PERSONA PENSIONADA YA QUE LABORO DURANTE 30 AÑOS PARA INSTITUCION DE SEGURIDAD MEDICA SOCIAL ELLA AL IGUAL QUE SU MARIDO SOLICITAN ESTE CREDITO PARA REMODELAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA YA QUE SE DAÑO CON TANTA LLUVIA Y GRANIZO.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a retiree who worked for the Institucion de Seguridad Medica Social ("Institute of Social Health Insurance") for 30 years. She and her husband are applying for this loan to repair the roof of their house because it was damaged by heavy rains and hail.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair roof.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Maura is 35 years old and married with three children. she sells prepared meals of pig intestines (tripe) at the last stop of an urban transport company. She works from 8am to noon. During summer vacation, she travels to the Ayachuchan tropical forest to sell potatoes, cheese and fish and buy tropical fruit to sell in the Nery Market in Ayacucho.  Maura needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes and firewood.  Maura’s dreams are to build her own home, to educate her children, and to expand and stabilize her business.

loans.use: Buy potatoes and firewood

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es: Doña Ruth tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos de 15,18 y 22 años de edad, dos estudian el mayor trabaja, la Sra.
