Ruth vende variados platillos de comida, y fritanga desde hade seis años en su casa, su mayor dificultad es en el invierno ya que donde vende la comida no hay techo y las lluvias hace que sus ventas bajen, inicio con financiamiento en afodenic  ya es su séptima solicitud y ha sido de gran beneficio para su familia ya que gracias a la oportunidad que le dio con el préstamo de invertir ha podido ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien y subsistir ya que con su esposo se separo y todos los gastos lo ha tenido que cubrir ella, con esta solicitud quiere hacer unas mejoras en el techo ya que su casa es bien baja y quiere levantar el techo, va a comprar perlines entre otros materiales, y reparar una puerta para tener mejor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ruth is 46 years old, and lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte in the capital of Managua, with three children who are 15,18, and 22 years old. Two of her children study and the oldest works. Señora Ruth has sold various types of food and fried snacks from her house for six years. Her major difficulty is in the winter since where she sells the food there is no ceiling and the rains cause sales to drop. She began with a loan from Afodenic and this is her seventh loan request. It has already greatly helped her family. Thanks to the opportunity she has with the loan to invest, she has been able to help her children stay in school and survive, since she and her husband have separated and all of the expenses have had to be covered by her. With this request, she wants to make improvements to the roof, since her house is very short and she wants to raise the roof. She is going to buy timber for rafters amongst other materials, and repair a door in order to have better security for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en: Lidia is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Lidia is 40 years old and married with three children. Lidia sells food from a cart from her home, located in the Conchopata neighborhood. Her specialty is Salchipollos (sausage and chicken). She works from 4pm to 11pm. She and her husband also own a car, which her husband uses as a taxi.  Lidia needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy oil, cream, mustard, chicken and potatoes.  Lidia dreams of providing her children with a good education and dreams that they will grow up to be professionals.  She would also like to build a second floor onto her house and buy another car.

loans.use: Buy cream, mustard, chicken, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu M. is 34 years old,  married and mother of three children, who are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop in Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua, Ghana where she lives with her family. Salamatu has been selling clothing materials, blouses and skirts, women slippers and clothing bags for the past eight years to support her family. She must, however, operate on a small scale due to lack of funds. 

This loan would increase her working capital and expand her business It would allow her to purchase a higher quality stock and upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing materials, ladies wear, headscarfs and slippers. Salamatu is a member of a borrowing group called God is good Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral, to access loans and provide support and assistance to one another with repayment.

loans.use: To purchase clothes; jeans, ladies wear and slippers

loans.name: Nanci

texts.en: Nanci is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Nanci is 42 years old, widowed and has two children. She is a teacher, and works in an educational center in the Quinua district. Nanci has an internet café in her house, located in the Ciudad de Cumana Association, a neighborhood near several schools. In the morning an employee runs the café, and Nanci runs it in the afternoon. She also sells sweets, office supplies and photocopies.  Nancy needs a loan of 900 soles to buy Christmas gifts to resell in her store.  Nanci dreams of expanding her business and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

loans.use: Buy Christmas gifts to sell

loans.name: Angela Presciliana

texts.es:
La señora Angela tiene 48 años de edad, es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Sepúlveda 440, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque prefirió aprender repostería en un centro de capacitación.
Se casó y actualmente tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 dependen de ella.
Angela vende menú diariamente y se dedica a preparar bufets para quinceañeros, matrimonios, etc., también elabora polladas y parrilladas para eventos de instituciones que lo soliciten. Su negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró arroz, azúcar aceite, incrementó su servicio.
Con este crédito de S/. 600 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, incrementará su negocio, piensa comprar manteles para sus mesas.
Angela sueña con ampliar su local y tener uno propio.
texts.en:
Angela is 48years old, and she is the president of the community bank "Luis Alberto Sanchez II". She lives at Sepulveda 440 in the district of Moche in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

She went to school up to grade 8, but she didn't keep going to school because she preferred to learn to be a cook in a vocational school.

Angel sells her menu items daily and she also caters special events like Sweet-Sixteen parties, weddings etc. But she also makes BBQs for company events. Her business is run from her home.

The first loan, amounting to S/.300, was repaid in 4 months and she used the funds to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking oil. And she increased her business. With this loan, amounting to S/.600 soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will improve her business by purchasing tablecloths for her tables.

Angela dreams of expanding her work space and one day owning her own store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tablecloths for her tables.

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira tiene 50 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Espinar 221, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios. Se casó a los 26 años y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 aún son estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida, especialmente los días sábados y domingos que prepara comida especial, lo mismo que los lunes que elabora el tradicional shambar. El negocio se desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, piensa invertir en carne de cerdo y menestras.
Edelmira sueña con  tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Ms. Edelmira S. is 50 years old. She is a member of the Luis Alberto Sánchez II microfinance institute. She lives on Espinar 221 Street, in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She completed high school, but due to a lack of financial resources, she was unable to continue her studies. She got married at 26 and has 6 children, 3 of whom are still studying.

She sells food for a living, especially on Saturdays and Sundays, when she prepares special foods. On Mondays, she makes shambar, a traditional stew. She runs the business from her own home.

She plans to invest this loan of 300.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing pork and legumes.

Edelmira dreams of owning a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Lourdes tiene 19 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y  vive en la calle Sepúlveda 440 A, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudia el segundo ciclo de Administración de Empresas.
Su negocio consiste en el alquiler de vehículos  de transporte, un auto para taxi y una moto para moto taxi.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas invirtió en repuestos.
Con este crédito de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará una carpa y pintura para la moto.
Lourdes sueña con terminar su carrera y hacer surgir su negoció y el de su madre.
texts.en:
Miss Lourdes is 19 years old and lives on 440 A Sepúlveda Street, in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Alberto Sánchez II microfinance institute.

She is in her second year of Business Administration.

Her business consists of renting transportation vehicles—one taxi cab and one motorcycle taxi.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing spare parts.

With this 400.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a cover and paint for her motorcycle.

Lourdes dreams of finishing her degree so that both her and her mother’s businesses can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle cover and paint

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en: Marivel is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Marivel is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She works at the municipal office as a janitor. Marivel also sells clothing and shoes on credit by special order to friends, family members, and co-workers. Marivel needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy t-shirts, pants and children’s clothing.  Marivel dreams of improving her business, of opening up a stable store, and that her children will get ahead in life by studying.

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, pants and children's clothing

loans.name: Yesenia Lisbel

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia tiene 24 años edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en el pasaje Santa Lucia 223, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que falleció su mamá y los recursos económicos ya no eran los de siempre. Se casó y tiene un hijo de un año seis meses que depende de ella.
Vende golosinas y comida por las tardes en su casa, por ejemplo vende pescado frito con yuca, sangrecita, arroz chaufa, etc. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró golosinas e insumos para sus comidas.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará golosinas y arroz, aceite, etc.
texts.en:
Ms. Yesenia T. is 24 years old and lives on 223 Santa Lucia Street, in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad. She is a member of the Alberto Sánchez II microfinance institute.

She finished high school, but was unable to continue her studies because her mother passed away, which meant that she no longer had the financial resources that she used to. She got married and has a son who is a year-and-a-half.

She sells sweets and meals—such as fried fish with yucca, sangrecita (black pudding), arroz chaufa (a rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham), etc.—in her home in the evening.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased sweets and the ingredients needed for meal preparation.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase sweets, rice, cooking oil, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "PRIMAVERA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARLENE Y CONFORMADO POR 16 SOCIAS QUE EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO, SU CARACTERÍSTICA ES LA SERIEDAD Y LA RESPONSABILIDAD CON LA QUE TRABAJAN  EN SUS PUESTOS D. VETA D. COMIDA, ROPA, ABARROTES, HORNEADOS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS, ALGUNOS SE DEDICAN AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO Y OTRAS TRABAJAN EN SERVICIOS DOMESTICO. ELLAS COMENTAN QUE TIENE  QUE TIENE QUE SEGUIR TRABAJANDO PARA SOSTENER A SU FAMILIA Y PAGAR SU DEUDA PARA DEMOSTRAR QUE SON GENTE CUMPLIDA Y MUY CAPAZ EN SU TRABAJO Y SER SOCIAS CONTINUAS D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL. EL CRÉDITO QUE SOLICITARON LAS SOCIAS. ES PARA LA COMPRA D. INSTRUMENTOS D. TRABAJO, INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACIÓN D. SUS PRODUCTOS Y D. ESTA MANERA  PODER MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS Y SU CALIDAD D. VIDA, EN CUANTO A LA EXPERIENCIA NO ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE TRABAJAN CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE SE NECESITA PARA EL PAGO D. SU CRÉDITO
texts.en:
The group "Primavera" or "Spring" is represented by Señora Marlene and is comprised of sixteen members who have devoted themselves to doing business.Their characteristics are the seriousness and the responsibility with which they work in their positions selling food, clothing, groceries, baked goods, and other products. Some have devoted themselves to public transportation and others work in domestic service. They comment that they have to continue working to support their family and pay their debt, in order to demonstrate that they are capable and polite people in their work and are continuous members of the foundation Agrocapital. The loan that the members request is to buy work instruments and supplies for the production of their products. In this manner they can improve their income and their quality of life. As for the borrowing experience, it is not the first time that they have worked with supportive groups and they know the responsibility that is necessary in order to pay back their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miriam Danixa

texts.es:
La señora Miriam tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Sepúlveda 300, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero por su situación económica no continuó estudiando. Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes.
Miriam vende carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado La Amistad.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró carne de gallina y empezó también a vender dicha carne.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en productos naturales para la salud. 
Miriam sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms Miriam is 38 years old and belongs to the community bank Luis Alberto Sánchez II. She lives on Sepúlveda 300, in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her elementary schooling but because of her economic situation, was unable to continue her studies. She married at 19 years of age and has 5 children who are in school. Miriam sells chicken meat in a stand in the La Amistad market. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she repaid in 4 months, she bought chicken meat and began selling it. With this loan of S/. 500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase natural health products. Miriam dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural health products

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Honorata is 31 years old and married with five children. She sells sweets and drinks from a mobile cart in the Warpas neighborhood from 8am to 7pm. Honorata needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy cookies, candy and gum.  Honorata’s dreams are to build a house and for her children to finís school.

loans.use: Buy cookies, candy and gum

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
La señorita Nelly tiene 42 años de edad, pertenece al  Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Leoncio Prado 777, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, pero más le gustó trabajar y ya no continuó estudiando.
Nelly vende peluches y regalitos en su casa. Como es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, incursionó en la venta de verduras y molidos en un puesto del mercado llamado La Baratura.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, comenzó a vender, choco tejas,  marcianos y gelatina.
Con este crédito de S/. 700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en verduras, molidos y peluches navideños.
Nelly sueña con tener un negocio con capital propio.
texts.en:
Nelly is 42 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” and lives at Leoncio Prado 777, Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed third year of secondary school, but she liked working more so she didn’t finish her education. Nelly sells plush toys and small gifts from her home. As she is a hard working and enterprising woman, she also sells vegetables and ground spices in a stand in the La Baratura market. With her first loan for S/.300 which was repaid in 4 payrments, she began to sell gelatins, popsicles, and chocolate snacks. With this loan for S/.800, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in vegetables, ground spices, and Christmas plush toys. Nelly dreams of having a business with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, ground spices and plus Christmas items

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica T. is married and the mother of three children, aged 8, 5 and 3 years respectively. She is a 29 year old trader who trades in charcoal in the neighborhood of Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua, where she lives with her family. With this business, she has supported her first born child through senior high school.

Charcoal is a popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. It is produced by burning fresh wooden logs. Monica obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages surrounding Koforidua and then retails it to her customers.

With the loan, she would like to purchase a bulk supply of charcoal to serve her customers. She believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children. She is a member of a borrowing group called God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantee for one another as social collateral, and support to one another with loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchasea a bulk supply of charcoal.

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es tesorera del Banco Comunal Luis Alberto S. II, tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la calle Leoncio Prado 777 interior B, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el primer ciclo de  Educación Inicial en un Instituto Superior Pedagógico, pero no concluyó con sus estudios porque se casó. Actualmente vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años.
Su negocio consiste en la venta y confección de manualidades y también venta eventual de mercadería que le traen de la ciudad de Lima. Realiza el negocio en su casa y de manera ambulante en el mercado La Baratura.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en comprar material para sus manualidades, por ejemplo hilo, alambre, chaquiras.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses piensa comprar juguetes para la campaña navideña.
Patricia sueña con tener una gran tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia is treasurer of the Communal Bank Luis Alberto Sanchez II, is 25 years old and lives on the street Leoncio Prado 777 B, district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the first cycle of Early Education in a Higher Teaching Institute, but did not complete her studies because she got married.She now lives with her husband and son of 4 years. Her business is the manufacture and sale of handicrafts and she also sells merchandise brought from the city of Lima. She conducts business at home and also in the market. With the first loan of 300 soles (US $100), repaid in 4 months, she invested in purchasing materials for her crafts, such as wire and beads. With this amount of 300 soles (US $100), which will be paid off in 4 months, she is thinking of buying toys for the Christmas season. Patricia dreams of having a big store.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toys for Christmas

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 32 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Atiende todas las tardes en su puesto de ropa, sus prendas son hechas a base de lana, tejidas a mano  como también a máquina de tejer, los artículos de vestir que vende, van desde chalinas hasta chompas, con los más bellos puntos y colores. Este negocio surge por la idea de tener un ingreso fijo, ya son 14 años de vender estos artículos, sus prendas tienen la línea de ser artesanías, se ubican en un local comercial donde se expenden productos nativos de su zona. Todas las tardes es su horario fijo de atención y por las mañanas no descuida la atención de sus 2 hijos. Para Gloria la única dificultad es su saturado tiempo, pero poco a poco lo va superando. Solicita este préstamo por primera vez,  pero se compromete a ser muy responsable en sus pagos. Con este dinero podrá adquirir más mercadería y mejorar su stand, Gloria compra directamente de los artesanos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years off age, she lives with her husband and their two children. In the afternoons she tends to her clothing stand. The clothes are made of wool, hand knitted and also machine made. The articles of clothing she sells are anything from sweaters to jackets, with only the most beautiful stitching and colors. This business came about because she wanted a steady income. It has now been 14 years since she's been selling these items, now known to be artesan's fine crafts. Her stand is located in a zone where many other items native to her region are sold. Gloria's only challenge is she doesn't have enough time, but slowly she is improving. She is requesting a loan for the first time, but she is committed to be responsible with her payments. With these funs she will be able to add selection to her merchandise and improve her sales. Gloria buys directly from artesans.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more stands to improve her clothing store.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 25 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto S. y vive en el Pasaje Santa Lucia 223 interior B, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y se casó a los 23 años. Actualmente tiene un hijo de 3 años.
Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de choco tejas, vende en su casa, en la puerta de una fábrica y le hacen pedidos de una empresa.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en materiales y moldes para las choco tejas.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará cobertura de chocolate, pasas, nueces, pecanas y manjar.
Sandra sueña con tener una tienda muy grande.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Alberto S.’ and lives at Pasaje Santa Lucia 223 interior B, Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad state, Perú. She completed secondary school and married at 23 years of age. Today she has a 3 year old son. Her business consists of making and selling chocolate candies which she sells from her home, at the gate of a factory and a business orders directly from her. With her first loan for S/. 300 which was repaid in 4 payments, she invested in ingredients and molds for the chocolate candies. With this loan for S/. 500, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy chocolate for melting, raisins, nuts, pecans, and caramel. Sandra dreams of having a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chocolate for melting, raisins, nuts, pecans, and caramel.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolaza tiene 58 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos que la poyan. Su stand D. venta lo arrendó en una casa comercial ubicada en el centro D. su ciudad, venD. todo clase D. prendas D. vestir para damas jóvenes, por ello tiene que estar enterada D. lo ultimo en tendencias D. la moda, para que D. esa manera asegure las ventas diarias. Con esta actividad Nicolasa ya lleva 3 años y medio, le puso nombre a su establecimiento y se llama Boutique Chabela. Sus deseos siempre son el D. trabajar constantemente en su propio negocio, por eso no considera relevante los días en que las ventas puedan ser bajas, ya que hay días en las que se superan las metas. Para Doña Nicolasa es la primera vez que trabaja con esta forma D. préstamo, a la cual se compromete trabajar con mucha responsabilidad en la devolución  puntual con su crédito. Con este dinero podrá aumentar su capital D. trabajo, adquiriendo más prendas D. vestir para venderlas y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 58 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She rents a stall in a building in the center of town where she sells all manner of clothing for young ladies. To ensure her daily success she must be current with the latest fashion trends. Nicolasa has had her shop, named “Boutique Chabela,” for three and a half years. Owning her own business is her dream, so she is not discouraged on days when sales are slow. She is focused on days when she surpasses her goals. This is Nicolasa's first request for a loan of this sort, and she is committed to working responsibly to repay it on time. This loan will increase her working capital. With it, she will purchase more clothing to sell and will therefore increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Berita Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas ubicado en el Jr. Pucallpa Nº 655, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y tiene el apoyo de su esposo. Vende todas las noches en el patio de su vivienda.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 kilos de arroz, 2 racimos de plátanos, 3 pollos, 5 kilos de chorizo, etc.

Berita trabaja día a día y con mucho entusiasmo para darles una mejor educación a sus queridos y pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Berita D. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on Nº 655 Pucallpa Street, district of Callería, Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and has 2 dependent children. She is married, and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in food sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 2 years.

She currently owns the aforementioned business and has her husband’s support. She sells food every night on her own patio.

With this 1,800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 4 kg of rice, 2 bunches of plantains, 3 chickens, 5 kg of chorizo, etc.

Berita works everyday with so much enthusiasm in order to provide her beloved young children with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, plantains, chicken, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en la Av. Yarinacocha Nº 2500, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. En las mañanas se va al mercado a comprar sus productos para su bodega y por las tardes atiende su negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, gaseosas, ¼ de huevos, golosinas, etc.

Bertha es una mujer trabajadora y gracias a la ayuda de Manuela Ramos, su negocio ha crecido y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha R. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Nº 2500 Yarinacocha Avenue, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and has 3 grown-up children. She is married, and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest the first 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in soft drink sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 3 years.

She currently owns an in-home general store. In the morning, she goes to the market to purchase products for her store, and in the evening, she runs her business.

With this 1,300.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 2 crates of milk, soft drinks, eggs, candy, etc. Bertha is a hard-working woman who wishes to keep advancing in life. Thanks to Manuela Ramos’ support, her business has grown.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, eggs, candy, etc.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Progreso ubicado en la Av. Sáenz Peña Nº 1109, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de comida. De lunes a viernes vende de 5 a.m. a 5 p.m. con la ayuda de su hija.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 8 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 4 kilos de carne, verduras, plátano, etc. 

Clara es una mujer que trabaja con mucho entusiasmo para darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clara is a member of the Communal Bank 'Mujeres del Progreso', located at Av. Sáenz Peña # 1109, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and is a single mother of 3 children; 2 are grown up and one is still dependent upon her. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in clothing to sell. She has now been a member of the bank for five years. Now a days, she sells food from monday to friday, 5am to 5pm, with the help of her daughter. With this loan of $650 USD, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will purchase 8 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 4 kilos of beef, vegetables, banana, etc. Clara is a woman who works with a lot of enthusiasm in order to give a better education to her youngest son.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 8 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 4 kilos of beef, vegetables, banana, etc.

loans.name: Dolly Dermis

texts.es:
La señora Dolly pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas ubicado en el Jr. Progreso Nº 168, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años de edad y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de jugos y hamburguesas, todas las mañanas vende en el patio de su hogar, brindándoles buena atención a sus clientes.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 3 kilos de betarraga, 7 papayas, 4 kilos de manzanas, 3 docenas de huevos, etc.

Dolly manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante, teniendo fe y entusiasmo para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolly S. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on Nº 168 Progreso Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and is a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are no longer her dependants. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in beauty product sales.

She currently sells hamburgers and juice every morning on her patio, providing excellent customer service.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 3 kg of beets, 7 papayas, 4 kg of apples, 3 dozen egg, etc.

Dolly states that all women can get ahead in life, as long as they have faith and enthusiasm for work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beets, papayas, apples, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
La señora Eldith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo Nº 354, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja preparando panes, es panadero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de panes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una panadería en casa y tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la preparación y administración de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/.  2,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 sacos de harina, 5 kilos de manteca, 2 paquetes de levadura, etc.
 
Eldith se siente contenta por todo lo que ha logrado y agradece al banco comunal por brindarle su apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Ms. Eldith A. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Nº 354 Montalvo Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has 3 children, 2 adults and 1 who is still her dependant. She is married, and her husband works as a baker. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in bread sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for 2 years.

She currently has her own in-home bakery, and has her husband’s support in preparing the bread and managing the business.

With this 2,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of flour, 5 kg of butter, 2 packages of yeast, etc.

Eldith feels happy for everything that she has accomplished. She is very grateful to the microfinance institute for giving her its unconditional support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "MARIPOSAS" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARÍA ESTHER, COMO UNA GRAN MAYORÍA D. LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO ELLA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS. LAS INTEGRANTES SON DUEÑAS D. PUESTOS D. VENTA D. COMIDA , COSMÉTICOS, TEJIDOS Y DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS D. ACUERDO A LA TEMPORADA. UNA D. LAS SOCIAS CUENTA QUE LA OBTENCIÓN DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTARÁ DESTINADO PARA LA REAPERTURA D. SU PUESTO D. VENTA D. TABACO EL CUAL DEJADO POR  CAUSA D. UNA ENFERMEDAD. EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO PERO SON GENTE QUE SABE D. SU RUBRO Y QUE PUED. SALIR ADELANTE SIN PROBLEMAS. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DESTINADO A LA AMPLIACIÓN D. SUS PUESTOS  ASÍ COMO AL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MERCADERÍA PARA LA VENTA. LAS SOCIAS YA TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN TRABAJOS CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS EN OTRAS FINANCIERAS POR LO QUE SABEN LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE IMPLICA UN FINANCIAMIENTO GRUPAL.
texts.en:
The group "Mariposas" or "Butterflies" is represented by Señora María Esther, who, like the great majority of the members of group, has dedicated herself to the selling of products. The members are owners of stalls selling food, cosmetics, weavings, and different products according to the season. One of the members says that if the loan is obtained, it will be allocated to the re-opening of her tobacco stall, which she left because of illness. There is a lot of competition in the market, but there are people who know the area and her shop will do well without any problems. The loan is allocated to enlarge the shop's area, as well as increase the amount of supplies and merchandise for sale. The members of the Mariposas already have experience working with supportive groups for other loans, through which they know the responsibility that is implied in a group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en la Av. Túpac Amaru Mz. 1 Lt. 1, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años D. edad, es viuda y es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. carbón. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con 3 carros como herramienta D. trabajo, estos carros trabajan transportando madera. Tiene el apoyo se sus hijos.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, etc.

Elvira demuestra felicidad porque cuenta con el apoyo del banco comunal y con la ayuda D. sus queridos hijos. Agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Ms. Elvira P. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Túpac Amaru Avenue, block 1 lot 1, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 67 years old, widowed, and has 5 grown-up children. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in charcoal sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 8 years.

She currently owns 3 trucks—her work tools. These trucks are used to transport lumber. She has her children’s support.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 4 tires, repair the engine, etc.

Elvira displays happiness because she has the support of both the microfinance institute and her beloved children. She thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 4 tires, fix engine, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 318, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, y es madre soltera con 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, vende sus pescados al por mayor y manda a la ciudad de lima. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para solventar su economía.   
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 400 kilos de pescado de todas las especies para mandar a sus clientes.

Josefina se siente muy contenta por sus logros. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda que le brinda y por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Señora Josefina belongs to the Women of Progress Communal Bank, located at the Jr. Commander Suarez Nº 318, district of Callería, Colonel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 39 years of age and is a single mother with 2 children; one of legal age and another that still depends on her. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in the sale of fish. She has worked with the communal bank for five years.

Currently she relies on the same business. She sells her fish wholesale and sends them to the city of Lima. This business offers her profits to settle her expenses.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 400 kilograms of fish of all species to send to her clients.

Josefina feels very pleased by her achievements. She thanks Manuela Ramos for all the aid that the bank offers her and for trusting in her.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 400 kilos of fish of all species

loans.name: Luz Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 474, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar y con la ayuda de su hijo quien es el que maneja su herramienta de trabajo. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 pares de amortiguadores y 2 frenos, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asiento, etc. 

Luz agradece al Banco por la ayuda brindada y por confiar en su persona. Desea tener dos movilidades más para mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz C. is a member of the Mujeres del Progreso (Women of Progress) microfinance institute, located on Nº 474 Comandante Suárez, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 62-year-old widow with 5 grown up children. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in selling chickens. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 5 years.

She currently owns a motorcycle taxi, and gets help from her son, who drives her work vehicle. This business yields her enough profits so that she can pay off her loan punctually.

With this 3,000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will fix the motor, have the seats re-upholstered, and purchase 2 tires, 2 pairs of shock absorbers, 2 brakes, etc.

Luz gives thanks to the microfinance institute for helping her and for trusting in her. She wishes to have two vehicles so that she can improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motor, upholster seats, purchase tires, shock absorbers, brakes, etc.

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es:
La señora Magda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Miraflores Nº 234, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad confecciona vestuarios D. bailes para alquilar en diferentes eventos. Este negocio le brinda grandes ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
  
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,100, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 15 metros D. telas razo o pana, 8 hilos D. diferente color, lentejuelas, etc. 

Magda manifiesta que recibe una ayuda del banco comunal porque su negocio y la estabilidad económica D. su familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Ms. Magda R. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on Nº 234 Miraflores Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 grown up children. Her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in soft drink sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 4 years.

She currently makes dance costumes that she rents for different events. This business generates good profits for her, so she can pay off her loan punctually.

With this 2,100.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 15 meters of satin or corduroy, thread in 8 different colors, sequins, etc. Magda says that she receives help from the microfinance institute because her business and her family’s financial stability have improved.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase satin, corduroy, thread, sequins, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en la Av. José Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz. A Lt. 18, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años de edad y es madre soltera con 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibó de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y lencería (ropa interior), tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/.  2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 docenas de blusas, ¼ de faldas, 2 docenas de pantalones, vestidos para niñas, 6 kilos de tela algodón, etc.

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio ha crecido. Se siente deseosa de seguir surgiendo en su negocio para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria V. is a member of the Las Divinas microfinance institute, located on José Faustino Sánchez Carrión, block A, lot 18, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 56-year-old single mother of 5 grown-up children. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in making apparel. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 6 years.

She currently sells clothing and undergarments for men, women and children.

With this loan of 2,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 4 dozen blouses, skirts, 2 dozen pants, girl’s dresses, 6 kg of cotton fabric, etc. Thanks to the microfinance institute, her business has grown. She wishes to keep moving her business forward so that she can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, cotton fabric

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Mz. C Lt. 9, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años de edad y es madre soltera con una hija mayor de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de plátano. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 100 pollos y alimento ( un saco de inicio, engorde y crecimiento).
 
Maria manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para su familia y agradece a Dios por la oportunidad que le brinda para tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria A. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Cesar Vallejo Street, block C, lot 9, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 55-year-old single mother with one adult daughter. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in selling plantains. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 5 years.

She currently raises chickens for a living. This business yields her enough profits so that she can repay her loan punctually.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 100 chickens and chicken feed (1 sack of growing ration, and finishing ration).

Maria states that Manuela Ramos is a big help for her family, and she gives thanks to God for giving her the opportunity to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 100 chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Bertha is a member of the Aleli Village Bank.  Bertha is 44 years old, married and has six children.  Bertha runs a store from her house, where she sells dry goods, vegetables and meat. She opens every weekday, and her daughters and her husband help her run the store. On Sundays, Bertha sells used clothes in the Las Americas Fair. Bertha needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy sugar, rice and pasta.  Bertha’s dreams are for her children to get professional degrees and to offer a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and pasta

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo Lobo Nº 288, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas y también al cuidado de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas Kola Real, 5 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, 2 cajas de galletas, etc.
 
Patricia manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella y para todas las socias de cada banquito.
texts.en:
Patricia participates in the Communal Bank Las Golondrinas, in Calleria, Coronel Portillo Province, In Ucayali. Patricia, 40, is a widow and has two grown children. The first loan that Patricia received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles) was invested in purchasing chickens to raise and sell. She has been working with the communal bank for a year. Currently, Patricia sells candy, sodas and other snacks, while taking care of her home. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to be paid back in 4 months. The loan will be used to restock with 5 cases of Kola Real sodas, 5 packages of disposable bottle sodas, 2 cases of cookies, etc. Patricia is grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides to her all all the other members of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sodas, cookies, etc., to restock

loans.name: Trinidad Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac Nº 130, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre de 10 hijos, 9 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte su mercadería a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 docenas de faldas, 4 docenas de blusas, 2 docenas de pantalones, medias, etc.

Trinidad se siente contenta por todo lo que ha logrado en la vida y agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Trininad participates in the Communal Bank Las Divinas, in Calleria, Coronel Portillo Province, in Ucayali. Trinidad is 61 years old, is married and has 10 children; one of them still lives at home. Her husband works driving a moto-car. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos field partner (300 soles) was invested in the sale of prepared food. She has been working with the communal bank for five years. Currently she sells clothing going house to house. In the morning she takes care of her household chores and in the afternoon she visits her customers. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles, to be paid back in 6 months. She will use it to buy two dozen skirts, four dozen blouses, two dozen pants, socks, etc. Trinidad is happy with her accomplishments and is thankful to Manuela Ramos field partner for the help she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing skirts, pants, blouses, socks to restock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. La Paz Nº 135, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera con 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella. Yolanda con el primer préstamo que  recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de gaseosas. Tiene la ayuda de su hija para la atención de su negocio.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 8 cajas de gaseosas Kola Real, 6 paquetes de gaseosas descartables y 5 paquetes de agua mineral.  

Yolanda agradece a Manuela Ramos por toda la ayuda que le brinda. Se siente feliz y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda participates in the Communal Bank Las Divinas, located in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali. Yolanda, 45, is a single mother of 3 children; two are grown and the youngest daughter still lives at home. The first loan that Yolanda received from Manuela Ramos field partner (300 soles) was invested in the sale of prepared food. She has been working with the communal bank for five years. Currently she sells sodas. Her daughter help her run the business. She is requesting a loan of 1,800 soles, to be paid back in 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase 8 cases of Kola Real soda, 6 packages of disposable bottle sodas, and 5 packages of mineral water. Yolanda is thankful for the help that Manuela Ramos has given to her. She is happy and eager to make the most of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sodas and mineral water to restock

loans.name: Damaris Margarita

texts.es: Doña Damaris tiene 40 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 15 años de edad,  su esposo labora como ejecutivo de ventas, habita en un barrio que se llama Enrique Bermúdez en la capital de Managua. La Sra. Damaris tiene una pulpería desde hace un año lo cual comenzó con ahorro que su esposo le dio, por las noche hace venta de fritanga, refrescos  para tener mas ingresos, con este préstamo que esta haciendo en Afodenic espera obtener mejores beneficios por que desea comprar mercadería varias  como ropa, cosméticos para aprovechar la temporada de diciembre, poder sastifacer a su clientela. Y darle a su hijo los estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Damaris Bermúdez is 40 years old, married, and has a 15-year-old son. Her husband works as a sales executive. She lives in a neighborhood called Enrique Bermúdez, in the capital city of Managua. Ms. Bermúdez has had her own general store, which she started with money that her husband gave her, for a year. In the evening, she sells fried snacks and soft drinks in order to earn extra income. With this loan that Afodenic is giving her, she hopes to have more benefits because she wishes to purchase assorted merchandise, such as clothing and cosmetics, in order to take advantage of the holiday season, satisfy her customers, and provide her son with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos de 7,9 y 22 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, doña Martha junto a su esposo administra el negocio que es una micelania y videos juegos, lo cual iniciaron vendiendo ropa por encargos y una sala de video juego lo cual ahora tiene mas amplia y con mas equipo de video juego, con las solicitudes que hace a Afodenic se ha beneficiado por que en cada préstamo invierte mas con esta solicitud es su quinta, la cual quiere para comprar productos varios como una planta telefónica, para brindar un nuevo servicios a sus clientes, también desea invertir en útiles escolares, invertir en mas carne blanca, que es la venta de pollo que se consume bastante por los nicaragüense por ser mas barata y mas saludable.  A largo plazo desea captar más clientes y dar estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She lives in the 380 neighborhood in Managua. She has three children ages 7, 9 and 22, who are still in school. Martha and her husband run a small general store and a video game store. They initially started business by selling clothes on demand, but currently, they also own a video game room that has been growing, as they buy more video game equipment. She has taken advantage of every request she has made to Afodenic, as she can invent more with each loan she obtains. This is her fifth loan request, which she will use to buy miscellaneous products as well a phone switchboard, to provide her customers with a new service. She would also like to invest in school supplies. And, she would like to invest in more white meat, specially chicken, as it is largely consumed by people in Nigaragua because it is less expensive and healthier than other types of meat. In the long term, she would like to attract more customers and to be able to pay for school fees for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a PBX and more store supplies

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, en la capital de Managua desde su juventud, tiene un hijo de 10 años que esta estudiando, su esposo trabaja de  electrónico. Doña Gloria inicio su negocio hace seis años vendiendo bisutería, hoy tiene una mini pulpería que vende granos básicos, gaseosas y otros productos, con la solicitud de crédito la quiere para comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, para ofertar a sus clientes, nuevos productos, y así obtener mejores ingresos. A largo plazo es incrementar el volumen de venta y quiere remodelar el local donde tiene su negocio para dar mejor servicios a sus clientes y atraer a otros clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and she has lived in region 380 in the capital city of Managua since her youth. He has a 10 year old son who is attending school, and her husband is an electrician. Gloria started her business 6 years ago selling fashion jewelry, and currenty she has a small convenience store were she sells basic needs items, soft drinks, and other products. With this loan she will purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics to offer her clients. New products will translate into better earnings. In the long term she plans to increase her sales and remodel the store where she carries out her business, to give better service and attract new clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua  que se llama 380, tiene 53 años de edad,  su esposa tiene  dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, que están estudiando, su esposa vende verdura ambulante para ayudar a los gastos de su familia, don Eduardo trabaja como bombero desde hade seis años, lo cual inicio como conductor en los bomberos con esta solicitud es la séptima lo cual quiere comprar materiales para construir un muro en la parte de enfrente de su casa para tener mas seguridad para su familia. A largo plazo es seguir prestando en Afodenic para seguir haciendo mejoras a su casa, a si como seguir prestando el servicio a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo V. lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called 380. He is 53 years old. His wife has 2 children, ages 15 and 17, who are still in school. His wife sells vegetables as a street vendor in order to help with the family expenses. Mr. V. has been working as a firefighter for six years. He started out as a fire truck driver for the fire department. This is his seventh loan request, with which he would like to purchase materials to build a protective wall in front of his house in order for his family to be safer. In the long run, he wishes to keep borrowing from Afodenic for home improvement, as well as keep providing services to society.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a protective wall

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Don Marvin tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama 380, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, cursan la primaria, el Sr. Marvin trabaja en servicios de seguridad desde hade tres años, el siempre ha trabajaba de albañil, con esta solicitud es la octava lo cual ha sido de gran beneficios  ya que ha ido mejorando su casa, con esta solicitud va a construir un cuarto para estar mas cómodo con su familia. A largo plazo es poder  terminar de construir su casa, y poder ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Marvin is 33 years old. He lives in the 380 neighborhood in Managua capital city. He is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10, who are in elementary school. Marvin has been working on the security service business for 3 years. He also has experience as a construction worker. This is his eighth loan, which he will use to build a room so he and his family could be more comfortable. He has also used his previous loans to make home improvements. In the long term, he would like to finish building his house, and to help his children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a new room

loans.name: Wilber Alexis

texts.es: Don Wilber tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama  los ladinos,  en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2 y 9 años de edad. El Sr. Wilber trabaja en enderezado y pintura desde hace quince años, por falta de financiamiento no ha podido tener su propio taller, con esta solicitud es la tercera que hace en  Afodenic lo cual ha podido hacer mejoras de su casa, con esta solicitud va ha comprar cuartones para cambiar el techo, a si como repellar paredes de la sala y el cuarto. A largo plazo es poder tener su propio taller que es uno de sus metas para obtener mejores ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Wilber is 34 years old. He lives in “Los Ladinos” neighborhood in Managua capital city. He is married and has two children, ages 2 and 9. Wilber has worked in a body shop for fifteen years. Due to lack of financing he hasn’t been able to open his own workshop. This is his third loan request to Afodenic, which he will use to buy dressed timber to repair the ceiling, as well as to plaster the living room and bedroom walls. He has also used his previous loans to make home improvements. In the long term, it is one of his goals to have his own workshop in order to make a larger income and to help his children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to plaster his home walls and to repair the ceiling

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Marta P. es muy esforzada y se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras comercializadas en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León. Es de importancia destacar que ella es madre de dos hijos y debido a que es soltera tiene el deber de mantenerlos ya que ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito el cual le permita la compra de los perecederos como lo son las frutas y verduras para continuar comercializándolas en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Marta P. is a very hard working woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 12 years in “La Estación” market in the city of León. Marta is a single mother with two children. She is the only support to her children, being a father and a mother figure at the same time. Today, she is requesting for a loan from Ceprodel to buy non-durable goods such as fruit and vegetables to continue selling them on “La Estación” market in the city of León.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
En el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León la señora Maura P. se destaca por ser una excelente cocinera ya que desde hace siete años se ha dedicado al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.

A pesar que es madre soltera de cuatro hijos ha seguido esforzándose por mejorar su condición económica y es por eso que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos los cuales le sirvan para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar dichos alimentos. Es por esta razón que ella hoy en día un vez mas espera que su petición le sea otorgada y de esta forma adquirir el crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima y continuar destacándose como una excelente cocinera en el mercado de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
On “La Estación” market in the city of León, Maura P. is well known for being an excellent cook. She’s been working on the food making and selling business for seven years. Even though she is a single mother with four children, she makes the best effort to improve her household economy and for that reason she seeks for support from Ceprodel to obtain loans to buy raw material to prepare her famous food. She hopes she will receive another loan to buy more raw material, so people at the market of the city of León could still see her as an excellent cook.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food raw material

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fatima del Rosario es originaria de la ciudad de León y se dedica con ahínco al negocio de venta de chinelas para damas y caballeros ofreciendo diferentes tamaños y estilos para sus clientes en el mercado la Terminal.

Su negocio inició desde hace 8 años y hoy en día ha logrado salir adelante supliendo las necesidades de su hogar. La necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el capital financiero para la compra de las chinelas por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así continuar con su negocio en su sector.
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario is originally from the city of Leon and she dedicates her time with great zeal to the sale of slippers for ladies and gentlemen, offering different sizes and styles to her clients in the markets of Terminal.

Her business started 8 years ago and she has seen success, and is able to supply her household with the necessities. She sees an urgent requirement to acquire capital funds to purchase sandals. She has engaged Ceprodel to obtain this loan and continue with her business in the area.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sandals.

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Lorenza L. todos los días a tempranas horas de la mañana abre su tramo de venta de refrescos el cual loas comercializa con el propósito de abastecer y beneficiar a sus tres pequeños hijos ya que es madre soltera y no recibe apoyo de nadie solamente sobrevive por los ingresos de la venta de refrescos.

Hoy en día la rozón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para la preparación de los deliciosos refrescos que ella vende. Es importante destacar que al recibir el crédito e invertir en la materia prima se apoya a que ella continúe con el mantenimiento de sus pequeños hijos y por ende de su negocio.
texts.en:
Very early every day, on “La Terminal” market in the city of León, Lorenza L. opens her shop to sell soft drinks. She works at the market to support her three small children as she is a single mother and she does't receive any other help. She lives from what she obtains from the soft drink sale. She is requesting for a loan from Ceprodel to obtain resources to buy raw material to prepare her delicious drinks. If she receives this loan she will be able to invest that money in buying raw material so she can keep her business open a earn more money to support her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to prepare soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
La elaboración y venta de tortillas es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María B. en el mercado la Terminal en León.
 
Desde hace 38 años se ha dedicado a este negocio el cual le ha sido el sustento para llevar el pan de cada día a su mesa y a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado, ha superado y mejorado en parte su tramo. Hoy en día ha solicitado un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Esperanza B. bakes and sells tortillas in La Terminal, a market in León. For thirty-eight years she has been in this business. It is what puts the bread on her table. She has partly improved her business -- in spite of the difficult circumstances she has seen and overcome. Now she has requested a loan in Ceprodel to buy raw material for baking tortillas. She hopes that her request for a loan will be granted so that she can use it to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by HannahLily P, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ledubina

texts.en: Ledubina is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents. For the past five years, Ledubina has worked in a tailor’s shop sewing clothing. She earns a percentage of the money received for each item, and the shop owner keeps the rest. Ledubina is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy liner material for clothing. She just started working with FINCA, and says it has been a big help so far. She hopes to save enough to one day open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: Buy lining material to sew clothes

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 36 years old, single, and lives independently. Ana sells sewing and knitting supplies (thread, yarn, buttons, zippers, needles) from a stand within her sister’s tailoring shop, and also makes clothing. She has had her stand for about two years now.

She just started working with FINCA this year, but says it has been a big help so far. Ana is requesting a loan of 750 soles to buy fabric to make custom clothing. Her goal for the future is to open her own tailor shop.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 49 years old and married with three daughters. Her nephew, who is an orphan, also lives with her.

Emilia travels to different regional fairs to buy grains, guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy), sheep and pigs. She slaughters the animals herself and sells the meat in the city of Ayacucho to stores, restaurants and individuals. She has been working this way for 15 years. Emilia had left FINCA years ago for health reasons, but she recently ran into one of FINCA’s loan officers, who remembered what a good client she had been and invited her to come back. She is currently starting a second loan cycle with Amor y Esperanza.

Emilia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothing in Lima, which she will bring back to Ayacucho to sell for the Christmas season. Her goal for the future is to make home improvements and to save up for old age so that she doesn’t have to depend on her children.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Guisenia

texts.en: Guisenia is a member of the Amor y Esperanza (“Love and Hope”) Village Bank. She is 30 years old and is a single mother to an eight-year-old son. Guisenia works in the Carmen Alto Market selling grains; she has been in this line of work for the past 10 years. Guisenia is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy different kinds of flour (e.g. flaxseed flour, wheat flour) and dried beans and corn. Guisenia’s dream is to finish building her home. She’s almost finished; she just needs to install the roof.

loans.use: Buy flour, dried beans and dried corn

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun T., age 28, and her husband Sao Doch, age 31, are villagers in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and work as farmers. However, they have such a small patch of land to cultivate that it is difficult to realize any return upon their investment of time and hard work. Thus, Mrs. Noeun T. are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 Riel in order to purchase another area of farmland on which to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To purchase another parcel of land for rice cultivation

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem S. is a 57-year-old villager in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on a small piece of land which she owns. To improve her living conditions, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Riel in order to buy a parcel of land to cultivate rice and thereby increase her rice revenue. Her husband's name is Mr. Yim Tha; he is a palm juice collector who gathers the juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Noem S. has three children two of whom are firewood sellers while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a parcel of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is a 37-year-old farmer in Andoung Sareth Village in Takeo Province. She is widow with two children who are all enrolled in the local school. Facing greatly reduced income through farming, is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Riel in order to buy a cow for breeding and thus increase her income and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Mrs. Sovann T. is a married 34-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. Her husband is Mr. Seang Sarin. On their farm they face a field which is infertile. Mrs. Sovann T. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers for the field. Mrs. Sovann T. has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is only  three years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the field

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem M. is a 56-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. Her husband name is Min Song. They are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice; unfortunately, their field is increasingly infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Yoem M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers for their field. Mrs. Yoem M. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one is a driver, and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for their fields

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina M. is a 26-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. She faces a small problem on her farm because her field is infertile. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. Her husband is Toy Chan and is a construction worker. Mrs. Sina M. has two children who are only one year old and four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn H. is a 56-year-old villager in Ream Ankdeouk Village in Takeo Province; she is married to Keo Phorn, and together they own and operate a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Because their field is far from irrigation sources, Mrs. Sorn H. is seeking a loan to buy a water pump to make her fields more arable. Mrs. Sorn H. has three children, one of wH. is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her fields

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Mrs. Sarum K. is a villager in Ream Ankdeouk Village in Kampong Chnang Province; she is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She is a fruit seller in the local market, but as a widow it is difficult to make ends meet in her household. To improve her situation, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Riel with a plan to use the loan to purchase a wider variety of fruit to resell and thus expand her customer base.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire construction workers to build a new house

loans.name: Saloeun

texts.en: Mrs. Saloeun P. is a 29-year-old farmer in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province; her husband is Mr. Mey Sinong. They are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice. In addition to the farm, Mr. Mey Sinong is a firewood seller. Because the firewood business is going well, he wants to sell firewood door-to-door so his wife is seeking a loan to buy a cart to transport the wood. Mrs. Saloeun P. has two young children who are ages two and three years old.

loans.use: To buy a cart to transport firewood

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren H. is a 21-year-old farmer in Svay Thom Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Min Virak, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. They now face an obstacle in their farm's infertile soil. In order to make her fields more productive, Mrs. Ren H. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer for the field. Mrs. Ren H. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is still too young to work or study being five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the field

loans.name: Lav

texts.en: Mrs. Lav L. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. She is a 60-year-old widow and the mother of two; one child is employed in a garment factory while the other one stays at home to do the housework. She currently faces an obstacle in that her house is old and she does not have enough money to solve this problem. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to use in rebuilding her house.

loans.use: To buy timbers to help build her house

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.en: Mrs. T. lives in the Nghi Lien commune, in Vietnam. She is 41 years old and has two children. She has been a member of TYM since 2005. Her main source of income is raising cows and pigs. Mrs. T. would like to request a loan of $600 to expand her business and range of livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows and pigs

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng H. 40 years old and lives with her family in Ang Prasat village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ek Ou (on the left in the photo), owns a small store. Their three children attend the local school.
